jobDetails:
Temporary Paralegal

Salary: DOE

3+ years of related paralegal experience in probate law required

A leading medical school center is hiring a Temporary Paralegal to join their office in Shrewsbury, MA. In this role, you will serve as a resource for staff members primarily in matters concerning estate recovery and you will ensure the integrity of collection outcomes, according to federal and state estate recovery regulations.

Responsibilities


 Paralegal will refine and enhance current operations, implementing innovative methods to identify new cases, verify claims and recover payments originally paid by Medicaid
 Research, maintain and understand compilation of all Federal and State statutes and regulations pertaining to Third Party and Estate Recovery
 Maintain a caseload as assigned, following established protocols
 Identify benefits paid by Medicaid and calculate the total value to be recovered in each case
 Communicate and collaborate with probate courts, attorneys, hospitals, insurance companies and other relevant entities to insure all Medicaid related Estate Recovery cases are referred to the unit and processed accordingly
 Conduct legal research through the use of public databases and web based applications
 Research record of ownership and title of real estate at the Registry of Deeds

Requirements


 Bachelor’s Degree
 3 years related paralegal experience in probate law
 Paralegal certificate required
 Knowledge of Massachusetts statutes as it relates to Estate Recovery
 Understanding of Medicaid regulations as they govern eligibility requirements
 Proficient in Microsoft Office, web based solutions, and scanning software
 Proficient in Probate and Real Estate Law, Wills and Trusts, Chain of title research and insurance regulations pertaining to Medicaid qualifying annuities

A religious establishment in Natick, MA is seeking a Temporary Administrative Assistant to assist with various tasks around their tight-knit office. If you have experience with Adobe and Microsoft Office and are looking to gain further experience in web design, apply today!

 Collaborate and collect information to ensure accurate and informative bulletins are created

 High School Diploma
 1 year of office administration experience
 Experience with Adobe and Microsoft Office

 Excellent verbal and written communication skills

About Simon-Kucher & Partners For over 30 years, Simon-Kucher & Partners has helped development stage to Global Fortune 500 companies in addressing their strategic and marketing challenges. We are regarded as the world’s leading pricing advisor and thought leader. We focus on TopLine Power® by helping clients grow their top-line through strategy, pricing, marketing and sales. Globalization is a core element of our goals and strategy. Today we are an international and multilingual team of over 1,300 full-time employees from diverse academic and professional backgrounds in offices across the US, Europe, Asia Pacific, and South America.
Life Sciences Division
Life Sciences is one of our leading industry practices at Simon-Kucher & Partners. In the US we operate out of Boston, Chicago, San Francisco, and New York. We have advised 24 of the top 25 pharmaceutical companies, top 5 biotechnology companies, and 40 of the 50 largest medical device and diagnostics companies. We have developed strategies for 8 of the 10 worlds’ best-selling drugs. Roughly 75% of our projects have an international component.
Our core competencies include:

Market prioritization and portfolio development
Value proposition and trial-planning
Pricing and market access
Marketing and sales excellence

Additional requirements:
We are looking for outstanding candidate to support the growth of our Life Science Division in Boston.

Strong problem solving skills: You effectively combine analytical skills with business acumen to structure problems, deliver solutions and communicate insights
Entrepreneurial spirit: You are a self-starter and a finisher. You enjoy contributing to the growth of an organization. You show commitment to the success of your team.
Drive: You set ambitious goals for yourself. You are energetic, enjoy a fast pace environment and thrive in taking on responsibility.
Undergraduate degree required, higher education is a plus
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written

Furthermore, we expect you—as an experienced candidate—to grow quickly into the role of team leader. You would be responsible for synthesizing research and analysis into strategic recommendations for our clients, and for contributing relevant insights from your previous experience and relevant subject matter expertise.
What to include in your application Please attach all required documentation as incomplete applications will not be reviewed:

Cover Letter

Work authorization status
Preferred start date

Resume

Standardized test scores
Foreign language skills and level of fluency


Temporary visa sponsorship is at the discretion of Simon-Kucher & Partners LLC. At present, the company only sponsors applicants with graduate degrees.

At this time workers across the country are impacted by this crisis, specifically those employed in retail, restaurant, hospitality and the travel industry. At Trader Joe's we are working diligently to support our communities and ensure our customers have access to food and necessary household staples during this time. To those who have found their hours limited or jobs placed on hold, we invite you to join our Crew until your employer is able to welcome you back.

Is it you? 

Our Crew Members create a warm and friendly shopping experience in our stores. We answer questions, offer suggestions and ensure our customers know they are welcomed and cared for. We entertain customers and make grocery shopping an exciting adventure. Some responsibilities may include:


Working on teams to accomplish goalsOperating the cash register in a fun and efficient mannerBagging groceries with careStocking shelvesCreating signage to inform and delight customersHelping customers find their favorite products

You'll learn a lot. You aren't stuck doing one task here. Each Crew Member contributes to a WOW customer experience by participating in all aspects of the job.

If you have a passion for people and a fervor for food, we'd love to meet you. We can teach you the rest.

Trader Joe's is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to hiring a diverse Crew.

IT Validation Lead


 Requested Languages:
	
OR
PQE is a service provider company, leader in Pharmaceutical and Medical Device sectors since 1998. With a network of over 600 dedicated consultants, PQE delivers the highest level of expertise to more than 160 customers worldwide. An international group, PQE operates in over forty countries throughout Europe, Asia and the Americas. PQE offers a worldwide coverage with offices and representatives across Europe, Asia, the Middle East and Latin America, in order to better serve these specific local markets.

Due to a constant growth, PQE is looking for a new IT Validation Lead based in Boston or available to travel/ relocate to Boston for minimum 6 months.

RESPONSIBILITIES:



The role of IT Validation/SDLC Lead provides compliance leadership and direction to business and project teams in Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)/Computer System Validation (CSV)/Lab Systems/Lab Equipment/ IT Infrastructure Qualification standards and practices.

 This will be accomplished by:

Participating in the delivery of system solutions by documenting SDLC/CSV/Qualification activities.
Developing validation/qualification/migration/verification strategies for complex Information Management Systems, Software (including lab), data, mobility, infrastructure/components and/or business processes prior to release into a live environment per company procedure(s).
Executing validation/qualification/verification/migration strategies per company procedure(s).
Conducting High Level Risk Analyses and System Functional Risk Analyses
Preparing Test Plans and support system verification
Managing Test Incidents and Deviations
Supporting System Change Management
Providing validation/verification/qualification training to stakeholders as necessary.
Managing relationships with key customers and stakeholders to ensure the total validation/verification/qualification solution delivered to the customer meets/exceeds expectations.
Working with offshore team/testers.
Ensuring SDLC/CSV/Qualification activities are conducted in a cost-effective manner.


The Candidate will work and/or lead in multidisciplinary teams.

Experience with R&D and Quality Management Systems
Knowledge of GcP and GMP
Knowledge of Veeva Systems
Leadership
Relational & communication skills
Project management
Resource management
Prioritization skills/Time management
Strong work ethic
Availability to travel or to accept temporary relocations in US is a must
US Work permit (green card)

A well-known real estate development corporation is looking to hire an experienced Temporary Staff Accountant in Jamaica Plain, MA. In this role, you will be responsible for all phases of real estate projects in development, payroll, and accounts receivable.

The Boston Transportation Department (BTD) is seeking candidates for its Active Transportation community programs team. Team members support multiple education and outreach initiatives, with most of their time dedicated to on-bike youth and adult educational programming across the City. Under the supervision of the Active Transportation Director,



 Instruct bicycle skills, the parts of a bicycle, flat-repair, and bicycle safety rules to students ranging from elementary school children to older adults.
Lead group rides and on-bicycle skill-building activities, keeping the class organized and safe.
Select bicycle routes and assess risk.
Transport bicycles and helmets to/from sites, sometimes hundreds in a day.
Assist in maintaining fleet of bicycles and supplies.
Organize and execute events, under direction of an Active Transportation Coordinator.
Engage and educate the public about BTD projects, initiatives, and other transportation safety topics.
Remove and transport abandoned bicycles from the public right-of-way.
Respond to constituent requests, questions, and complaints.
Perform related work as required.


 Minimum Entrance Qualifications




 Experience teaching youth of varied ages.
Value working with diversity of people and team teaching methods.
Enjoy riding a bicycle and be able to ride for work.
Reliable, punctual, and strong work ethic.
Positive, professional attitude and capacity to adapt quickly in response to circumstances.
Proficiency in other languages, such as Spanish, Chinese, Vietnamese, Portuguese, Haitian-Creole, and Arabic, is beneficial but not required.
Bicycle maintenance and mechanic skills beneficial, but not required.
Valid driver’s license with good driving record preferred, but not required.
Ability to exercise good judgment and focus on detail as required by the job.

Pay & Terms:



 $14-$16 per hour, commensurate with experience.
Benefits not included.
10-month Employment Agreement with possibility to renew.
10-35 hours/week, with more hours April-June and September-October.
Summer, weekend, evening, and other opportunities are offered on an as-needed basis.
Boston Residency Required.

Temporary Mortgage Closing Coordinator

Salary: DOE

3 years of lending experience, 1 year Mortgage Loan closing experience required

An established bank in Cambridge, MA is looking to hire an experienced Temporary Mortgage Closing Coordinator to join its team. Under the general direction of the Vice President, you will perform a variety of administrative tasks in connection with the closing documentation of all mortgage loans.

Responsibilities


 Mortgage Closing Coordinator will perform quality control function to ensure completeness and accuracy of file and satisfaction of commitment conditions
 Ensure loan is authorized to close
 Monitor pipeline and schedule loan closings in accordance with rate lock and commitment expiration dates
 Serve as liaison with closing attorneys and correspondent lenders
 Review necessary loan documentation for accuracy prior to closing, request corrections if needed



 Prepare legal documents for consumer and mortgage loan closings and submit to attorney or Branch for completion and signatures

 Prepare and monitor management reports
 Monitor receipt of legal documents from closing attorneys
 Review legal documents for completeness and accuracy
 Ensure federal, state, and Bank regulations are properly adhered to by all parties
 Monitor results of operational audits and ensure operational preparedness for audits and regulatory examinations
 Ensure compliance with established policies, procedures, and laws and regulations

Requirements


 Bachelor’s Degree

 Working knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel
 Strong interpersonal and communication skills (both verbal and written)
 Ability to perform a variety of tasks simultaneously while adhering to deadlines and working independently
 Must be detail oriented and have excellent organizational, analytical and problem solving skills

Temporary Cluster Substitute Teacher -Full Time

Grade Level: Elementary

Start Date: August- December 2020

Locations: Various

About UP Education Network

UP Education Network is a school turnaround organization whose mission is to rapidly transform chronically underperforming district schools into extraordinary schools that sustain high achievement over time. UP transforms schools into exceptional learning environments in partnership with families and communities. Students in UP schools cultivate sharp minds, share their kind hearts, and explore their path and potential. UP graduates succeed on the path to college and pursue their passions. Today, UP is the largest nonprofit school network in Massachusetts and is privileged to serve a highly diverse group of more than 2,500 PK-8th grade students across five schools in Boston and Lawrence. All of our school based staff are district employees and receive district benefits.

Teaching at UP Education Network

Teachers hold primary responsibility for the development of curriculum, the instruction of content, and, most importantly, the success of UP Academy’s students.

At UP, your career is shaped by:

Opportunities for immediate impact: UP offers a chance to bring best practices found in high-performing schools to students previously enrolled in struggling schools, and to rapidly unlock the potential of these students.Talented, mission-driven colleagues: Our staff is enthusiastic, dedicated, and willing to do “whatever it takes” to put every student on the path to college.Collaboration and teamwork: Staff members collaborate and work closely together on grade-level or content area teams, using data to track student performance as well as guide instructional practice.Consistent professional growth and development: Members of our staff typically have bi-weekly check-in meetings with their managers where they receive targeted coaching and support. Additionally, the entire staff participates in weekly professional development sessions during the school year, kick-started by extensive training in August. 


Role

The Cluster Substitute is a full-time member of the school staff and plays the critical role of providing daily coverage at their specific campus as needed to ensure consistency in academic programming. Cluster Substitutes also have regular duties in the course of the day, similar to lead teachers. Cluster Substitutes participate in all ongoing professional development and receive ongoing coaching from instructional leaders. Cluster Substitutes at UP Academies often move into teaching positions after being successful in their role.Responsibilities:

Effectively execute lesson plans for assigned classesPerform all assigned school dutiesConsistently hold students accountable to school-based behavior management planParticipate in school-wide professional development and activities, as well as cohort meetingsCommunicating effectively with all students, staff and families

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree is required, Master’s degree is preferredCurrent authorization to work in the United States – A candidate must have such authorization by his or her first day of employment.A passionate belief in UP Academy’s mission, values, and educational model;A deep desire to work with educationally underserved student populations and their families;An unwavering commitment to the academic success and personal development of our students;An eagerness to set ambitious, challenging, and tangible goals, and a relentless drive to achieve them;An ability to thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment and a capacity to remain calm and focused when faced with unexpected challenges;Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, including strong public speaking skills;A sense of humility

Compensation:

We offer a competitive compensation package including comprehensive health benefits.

We encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply for any open position for which they are qualified. Our students must be exposed on a daily basis to a diverse group of powerful role models. Therefore, we have a responsibility to recruit, retain, develop, and reward a diverse and talented staff from a wide range of backgrounds to join our creative, mission-driven team.

Campus Recruiting - Investment Banking 2021 Summer Analyst - Boston



Location



MA - Boston



Business Area



Investment Banking



Employment Type



Temporary




Apply Now

Piper Sandler Investment Banking Summer Analyst Opportunity

About Piper Sandler

Piper Sandler is a leading, international middle-market investment bank and institutional securities firm, serving the needs of middle market corporations, private equity groups, public entities and institutional investors. Headquartered in Minneapolis, Minnesota, the firm has additional investment banking offices in New York, San Francisco, Charlotte, Houston, Boston, and Chicago. Piper Sandler investment banking specializes in a variety of financial transactions and focuses on the needs of growth companies in the consumer, financial institutions, healthcare, industrial growth, technology, media, telecommunications, and business services sectors. Piper Sandler is one of the premier investment banks focused solely on the middle market.

The Summer Analyst Program

Piper Sandler is currently seeking undergraduate students for our 2021 Investment Banking Summer Analyst Internship Program. Summer Analysts generally work 10 weeks within an industry or product group in Investment Banking and have the opportunity to learn financial modeling and basic analysis of companies and industries, as well as gain an understanding of the dynamics of the capital markets.

The Internship Program includes one week of formal training and a weekly speaker series from executives across the firm. Interns will also attend networking events during the Program. Our IB internships are a direct pipeline to our full-time IB Analyst positions for the following year. Opportunities in our Boston office may be anticipated in the following industry group: Technology.

The Internship Program is open to students who plan to graduate in December 2021 or May/June 2022.  As a part of our application process, please use the following link to complete your Suited profile:  https://app.wellsuited.com/join/QQFHqagHTbxtcSibC6at

Qualifications:


Outstanding academic achievement – minimum GPA of 3.3 or higher

Must plan to graduate in December 2021 or Spring 2022

Most candidates major in Finance, Accounting, Business, or Economics or have self-studied

Strong MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint skills

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Strong leadership and teamwork skills

Superior work ethic 

What We Look For

Piper Sandler seeks dedicated and motivated individuals possessing demonstrated academic achievement (minimally, a GPA above 3.3) as well as leadership, organizational and teamwork skills. The ability to create innovative solutions, articulate complex ideas and adapt to a rapidly changing environment is essential. Analysts must be able to work well under pressure and manage multiple projects. The most successful analysts have taken courses in finance and accounting and are very familiar with financial modeling.

Piper Sandler is an equal opportunity employer. For California residents, please see our privacy policy for more information: http://www.pipersandler.com/2col.aspx?id=197
jobTitle: Campus Recruiting - Investment Banking 2021 Summer Analyst

StudyPoint’s mission is to help kids succeed in school. We’re a growing ed-tech company and a leader in the online and face-to-face tutoring space.

While we’ve built out advanced capabilities in several marketing channels, we’ve done very little in paid social. We know it should be a successful channel for us, but we’ve never made the investment needed to get it off the ground. We’re looking to change that, and as a result we’re seeking someone to help us develop and implement best practices – with the goal of getting this channel to a sustainable ROI.

If you have solid experience in paid social media, can manage multiple key initiatives independently, are a creative problem solver, and take pride in deploying high quality marketing efforts, then we encourage you to learn more about joining our team.

Responsibilities

Manage the execution, and continuous improvement of existing paid social media campaigns.Build and launch new campaigns to drive profitable lead generation across several product lines and new initiatives.Work with members of our marketing team and our CEO to integrate and align on brand messaging.In addition to the above core responsibilities, you’ll have the opportunity to wear multiple marketing hats and contribute on projects as we look to continue innovating on the marketing front.

Qualifications

A strong intellect (and a Bachelor’s Degree).2-3 years of paid social marketing experience.Excellent written communication skills.An exceptional work ethic and meticulous attention to detail.A passion for marketing and helping kids.Ability to react and adjust to shifting priorities.

Benefits

This will be a full-time position, though it will start out as a temporary role with the potential to become permanent.Work from home.The opportunity to work side by side with senior leadership to shape marketing strategies and campaigns.A tremendous opportunity for learning and growth: you'll be a key player on campaigns that affect the entire organization's success. (You'll never find that level of responsibility and exposure in a large company.)A fun and supportive team that is as intelligent, as driven, and as passionate about their work as you are.The certainty that the work you do contributes to the educational success of students across the country, and soon -- the globe.

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary

Salary: $45,000.00 to $50,000.00 /year

Experience:

social media: 2 years (Preferred)social media marketing: 2 years (Preferred)

Bachelor's (Required)

Fully Remote

None

This Company Describes Its Culture as:

Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focusedOutcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance cultureTeam-oriented -- cooperative and collaborative

Monday to Friday

StudyPoint’s mission is to help kids succeed in school. We’re a growing ed-tech company and a leader in the online and face-to-face tutoring space.

While we think we have a great story to tell on multiple fronts, we’ve done very little PR throughout our 20-year history. We’d like to change that, and as a result we’re seeking someone to help us develop and pitch several storylines to local and national media outlets.

Job Description:

 A San Francisco based Fortune 500 ​American clothing and accessories retailing company is looking for an initial 1 year contract Global Strategic Sourcing Manager tasked with developing indirect category strategy and executing procurement activities in line with business needs. This includes supply market analyses, price / service-level benchmarking, sourcing events, supplier negotiations and ongoing supplier relationship management

Responsibilities Include:

• Manage procurement and sourcing processes and negotiating deliverables as well as costs, ensuring the brand is competitive in the marketplace, limiting risk, and driving to total cost/productivity and qualitative business objectives.

• Ensure that benefits from the strategic sourcing process are sustained and extended during the period of the contract through ongoing improvement strategies and initiatives post-sourcing

• Build and institutionalize market intelligence capabilities (people, database, information, analysis) within categories of focus regarding key markets, suppliers and solutions to support strategy development purposes

• Maintain relationships with cross-functional groups; assist with securing involvement of appropriate cross-functional staff for category teams

• Lead and coach sourcing analysts and cross-functional sourcing teams

Additional responsibilities for this position include:

• Build and leverage internal business partner relationships to effectively create value focused strategies that align with department goals.

• Build cross functional partnerships within the brand.

• Identify opportunities within categories to create value for the organization.

• Leverage spend analytics and market intelligence to evaluate sourcing opportunities.

• Develop should cost models as part of sourcing process.

• Build and execute Strategic Sourcing plans for assigned categories.

• Lead the development, distribution, and analysis of RFP’s and RFI’s.

• Ability to lead negotiations with vendors to achieve the optimal combination of quality, price, service, and risk mitigation to support business objectives.

• Capability to learn new categories quickly.

• Demonstrate critical thinking; consider all factors affecting a decision before making a recommendation.

• Assist in problem resolution between users and vendors.

• Ability to balance multiple priorities simultaneously.

• Capacity to develop partnership with Finance to ensure value from sourcing activities is properly captured by the organization.

• Skill to quickly build credibility and trust with relevant stakeholders.

• Maintain up-to-date knowledge in procurement practices & technologies and market trends related to assigned categories of goods and services.

 Qualifications

To qualify for the GS-12 level, you need to have at least one year of full-time experience equivalent to the GS-11 level defined as developing and applying analytical approaches, methodology, concepts and techniques to plan and carry out studies/projects to assist the organization in program planning, measurement, and/or progress evaluation; and making presentations to various audiences.

To qualify for the GS-13 level, you need to have at least one year of full-time experience equivalent to the GS-12 level defined as designing and conducting comprehensive management studies to identify and propose solutions to complex or controversial management problems with far-reaching scope or impact to a broad range of program operations; and assisting with educational outreach and/or training in a professional setting.

Your answers to the online assessment will be used to evaluate your competencies in the following areas: 1) Knowledge of policies, regulations, and fiscal procedures relating to federal grants management; 2) Ability provide training to various audiences; 3) Skill in project management; 4) Skill in written communication; 5) Skill in performing quantitative and qualitative analyses; 6) Ability to coordinate projects across multiple organizations; 7) Skill in planning, organizing, and/or directing teams; 8) Skill in oral communication.

Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional, philanthropic, religious, spiritual, community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.

RETAIL STORE GREETER: The greeter should be positioned just inside the front door all hours the store is open for business and will be responsible for the following:

• Greet customers as they enter the store while maintaining the 6-foot separation recommendation as described by the CDC.

• Inform customers of CDC guidelines to maintain the 6-foot separation recommendation from the CDC.

• Inform customers of hand sanitizer stations provided for our associates and customers located throughout the store.

• Offer customers a cart and wipe the handle of the cart with sanitizing wipes prior to giving it to the customer.

• Ask customers who are dropping off their equipment for repair to disinfect their equipment with the provided disinfectant solutions near the service department.

• Other duties as assigned

RETAIL SALES ASSOCIATES:

Greet customers and present credible product solutions based on customers’ needs; build repeat business through consultative solution selling and customer satisfaction.Perform merchandising activities such as processing freight, creating displays and end caps, completing markdowns and price changes and maintaining visual merchandising standards within your Area of Responsibility (AOR).

RETAIL CUSTOMER SERVICE (CASHIER) ASSOCIATES:

Provide superior service when assisting customers at the point of sale/checkout area; build repeat business through customer satisfaction.Process outgoing merchandise by completing credit and cash transactions.Obtain accurate name, address, and email capture of Micro Center customers.

MERCHANDISING/WAREHOUSE ASSOCIATES:

Execute the 18-minute Web Pick-Up processes and assist customers with carryout.Process incoming and outgoing shipments.Assemble floor displays and resets.

EDUCATION& EXPERIENCE:

High school diploma or equivalent.Passion for computers and technology preferable but not required.Ability to communicate professionally, handle multiple customers at a time.Sincere interest in helping customers and driving world-class customer experiencesProfessional appearance and demeanor.Physical requirements: lift up to 50 lbs., stand for prolonged periods of time.Shifts include hours before and after the store is open to the public and may also include mornings, nights, weekends and holidays.Previous experience relative to the position of interest is preferred but not required.

OUR GROWTH OPPORTUNITIES:

At Micro Center, we empower our employees to set their sights high and blaze their own trails. This is a place where your future success and growth are truly a result of your own efforts and achievements. Our teams are made up of motivated individuals who work hard to advance their careers. Join our team and see how hard work, loyalty, competitive spirit and unwavering commitment to the customer can take you and your career to new places.

BENEFITS& OTHER INFORMATION:

Micro Center offers competitive pay and an employee discount on merchandise for seasonal associates. Micro Center is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Pre-employment criminal background and substance abuse screening.

The MGH Sample Processing Laboratory (SPL) provides services involved in preparing research samples obtained from patients enrolled in clinical trials of investigational cancer treatments for storage and shipment. The primary role of this position is to transport samples from the holding stations located in the patient treatment areas of the hospital to the SPL and assist with their storage in ultralow temperature freezers.
PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:



Transport samples from holding stations in patient treatment areas to the Sample Processing Laboratory (SPL).
Transport packaging and shipping materials from other areas of the hospital to the SPL.
Assist with storing processed samples in the ultralow temperature freezers in GRJ1004.
Verify the temporary sticker on each sample transport tube and place them in the proper fiberboard storage box in the freezers based upon the DFCI protocol number.
Assist with packaging samples for shipment as needed in collaboration with the Clinical Laboratory Assistants responsible for shipping.
Transport packages to the MGH Mail Room for courier service pick up.
Provides assistance to disease group Clinical Research Coordinators (CRCs) working in the clinical areas of the hospital with unpacking, stocking, and organizing supplies such as kits, tubes, and shippers used as a consumable supply for a clinical trial.
Assist with or perform any other tasks as directed by senior laboratory staff.



SKILLS/ABILITIES/COMPETENCIES REQUIRED:



Ability to walk long distances within the hospital while carrying a sample transport container or pushing a cart on a continuous basis throughout the work day.
Ability to lift boxes that are moderately heavy (
Responsible for carrying a communication device (i.e. a pager) and responding to pages within a few minutes. Prioritizes workload based on demands of patient care.
Effective interpersonal communication skills.
A high level of responsibility and ability to work effectively with minimal direct supervision.
Ability to use Microsoft Office programs.



LICENSES, CERTIFICATIONS, and/or REGISTRATIONS (if applicable):
None
EDUCATION:
H.S. diploma or equivalent.
EXPERIENCE:
None
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY (if applicable):
None
FISCAL RESPONSIBILITY (if applicable):
None
WORKING CONDITIONS:



Duties will be performed within the hospital requiring the ability to work standing up and while walking for prolonged periods and lifting moderately heavy packages and objects.
Handling biological specimens, dry-ice, and other potentially hazardous materials.
The position involves a 40 hour work week, 8 hours/day Monday-Friday with a 30 min break, typically from 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., although the shift is subject to change to accommodate samples collected during the normal operating hours of outpatient clinics.

Are you an unemployed job seeker in the midst of a job search? 

A career changer attempting to transition into healthcare? 

A retiree seeking a second career? 

A stay-at-home parent preparing to reenter the workforce? 

Have you recently relocated to the Boston area?

At Bulfinch Temporary Service, a division of Massachusetts General Hospital and Partners HealthCare, our employee talent pool comes from all walks of life.

At present, we are considering applicants on an as-needed basis for both part-time and full-time Patient Service Coordinators to work in outpatient areas, with the potential to transition to temp-to-hire contingent upon satisfactory performance and changing staffing needs.

Job opportunities are located at Mass General Hospital,we also service a number of satelite locations in and around greater Boston for MGH affiliates.

While job responsibilities will vary dependent upon clinical practice needs - in which case we require a large degree of flexibility - in general, they will include the following:



Provide administrative support to healthcare providers within a high-volume ambulatory setting, and function as the primary interface between the patients and medical team. 

Schedule patient appointments, diagnostic testing, and surgeries. 

Obtain referrals and pre-certifications as needed. 

Register and/update demographic, PCP, and insurance information. 

Collect co-payments and fees. 

Oversee details of billing. 

Answer phones, and triage calls as appropriate. 

Photocopying, faxing, and filing. 



Associate or Bachelors degree, or equivalent secretarial training preferred. 

1 years' experience in a healthcare setting required for Level I role. (Additional experience required for higher level positions.) 

Demonstrated understanding of managed care and other insurance-related coverage plans. 

Computer literacy, including proficiency with Windows-based computer applications essential.
Demonstrated, accurate typing and data entry skills. 

Prior customer service experience. 

Knowledge of EPIC software a plus! 

Strong patient service orientation and well-developed communication skills. 

Qualified individuals must be available to complete a four-day, operations training program, and to work part-time or full-time, Monday-Friday, days. 

He/she should be a quick study, with a "can-do," positive attitude, and a demonstrated ability to be both reliable and punctual. 


Competitive candidates will also possess a professional demeanor, solid organizational skills, and the ability to work effectively as part of a team. Bulfinch Temporary Service employees often cover leaves of absences, vacations, as well as vacant, f/t openings, often resulting in temp-to-hire.

Qualified applicants who meet the above requirements, and are able to make a minimum one-month or more commitment, are encouraged to apply.

Ability to read academic, subject-specific information and write a reasoned and thoughtful analysis, as well as produce a creative interpretation, is a must. Experience with data analysis is desirable; strong skills related to the Microsoft Office Suite are expected. Fluency in English as a primary written and spoken language is required.

The successful candidate will demonstrate strong conceptual ability; high quality of mind; excellent writing skills; the ability to work productively under time pressure; ability to interact successfully with senior leaders; the capacity to work well with others and independently; willingness to travel (the travel expected is modest); and comfort in an academic environment.

Additional Information

This is a full-time term appointment starting this summer (start date flexible) through June 30, 2021, with strong potential for reappointment. The ideal candidate should be willing to commit to work at the Institute for two or more years in order to attain a mastery of the subject.

Applicants should not reach out to Professor Porter directly.

Harvard Business School does not offer visa sponsorship for this opportunity.

Applications will be considered on a rolling basis, a cover letter and resume are required for full consideration. Upon the review of application materials, applicants may be asked to submit a writing sample and transcript(s). All positions will be given a writing exam.

Department

Division of Research and Faculty Development

Pre-Employment Screening

Education, Identity

Job Function

Research

Job-Specific Responsibilities

The Institute for Strategy and Competitiveness (www.isc.hbs.edu) is a joint Institute of Harvard University and Harvard Business School, dedicated to supporting and extending the research pioneered by Professor Porter and disseminating it to scholars and practitioners on a global basis. The Institute is focused on the study of competition and its implications for the strategy of companies and other types of organizations, the competitiveness of nations, regions and cities, and new ways to address social challenges such as health care, environmental impact, corporate social responsibility, and philanthropy.

The Research Associate, based at the ISC and working directly with Professor Porter and team, will focus almost exclusively on Professor Porter’s health care research stream. There may also be some opportunity to work on strategy or economic development depending on the candidate.

Professor Porter’s 2006 book, Redefining Health Care, offers a value-based framework for understanding the problems in health care delivery in the United States and other countries (http://www.hbs.edu/rhc/index.html). A large body of additional research and curriculum development has occurred over the past several years. As a member of Professor Porter’s value-based health care team, the Research Associate will assist Professor Porter in advancing this research, including contributing to research projects in the ISC, and in partnership with outside organizations. The Research Associate is expected to develop case studies and other teaching materials, peer-reviewed publications, and aid in policy and management research. The Research Associate will also assist with developing presentations to domestic and international audiences, and representing Professor Porter to important constituencies.

The Research Associate will assist with the content development and administration of Professor Porter’s health care courses, currently including a week-long intensive seminar for Harvard graduate students and practicing physicians as well as two 3-day Senior Executive programs for C-level representatives of leading health care organizations. The Research Associate will work closely with the ISC’s health care research team and the rest of the ISC research team.

School/Unit

Harvard Business School

Job Description:

 Our large non-profit in Washington, DC is looking for a full-time SEO Strategist for a long term role onsite in DC.

MUST HAVE a strong organic search history and be able to create/ implement strategies to improve search ranking for highly competitive keywords.

Establish product, service and product development priorities based on projected results considering overall short and long term returns against the assets and resources expended. Work closely with other departments to ensure Marketing priorities are consistent with the strategic plan and activities match established and agreed to priorities; Conduct customer and competitive research to ensure that the company is providing its customers with the products, technical support and services they desire at prices that generate the greatest total dollar return to the Company across its total product line. Research to identify new product and services opportunities that match our core competencies; Develop and provide marketing materials to support all product and service sales efforts including those of our sister companies and distributors. Support internal communications, marketing, training, motivational and incentive development efforts; Identify and implement procedures and systems to ensure the Company’s marketing support functions are consistent and as efficient as possible while meeting internal and external customer needs.

This individual must be strategic, analytical, organized, and efficient – often managing multiple SEO projects and priorities at one time. Mastery of SEO best practices, and proficient in technical SEO initiatives. Expert user of SEO software without a dependency (Conductor Searchlight, Google Search Console, Screaming Frog, and SEMRush). Strong proficiency with web analytics tools (Adobe Analytics) and a strategic thinker. Track record for delivering projects and completing tasks on time. Solid understanding of online marketing reporting and quantitative analysis. Excellent written/verbal communication and interpersonal skills: enthusiastic, team player, professional, well organized, self-starter, serious commitment to hard work.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities:

• Contribute to the achievement of established department goals and objectives and adheres to department policies, procedures, quality standards and safety standards.

• Develop, manage and implement holistic SEO strategies.

• Improve traffic and search ranking for priority keywords for 15 marketing channels.

• Partner with developers and content specialists to promote SEO best practices.

• Pro-actively analyze SEO performance and conducts ongoing technical audits, identifies technical limitations, analyzes site health and recommend and implement strategies.

Identifies opportunities and analyze key performance indicators in the marketplace to improve search visibility, and consistently improve engagement resulting in qualified traffic through organic search.

• Analyzes, strategizes, implements, monitors, and report ongoing SEO efforts to stakeholders on ensuring that business goals are met.

• Leverage dashboard data and reports to evaluate the degree of success of SEO efforts to develop and recommend SEO initiatives and campaigns.

• Execute tests, collect and analyze data and results, identify trends and insights in order to create monthly, quarterly and yearly SEO strategies.

Professional Competencies:

• Ability to foster strong business relationships at various levels.

• Attention to detail and the ability to effectively multi-task in a deadline driven atmosphere.

• Ability to clearly and effectively articulate thoughts and points.

• High levels of integrity, autonomy, and self-motivation.

• Excellent analytical, organizational, project management and time management skills.

Qualifications:

• 5+ years of leading SEO initiatives and strategies including experience in the execution of SEO recommendations with a proven track record of results.

• Sound business acumen, financial analysis skills, strategic skills and common sense.

• Demonstrated knowledge in analyzing and interpreting complex data.

• Proficient and superior skill sets with: Excel, • PowerPoint, Word and Outlook.

• Proven ability to manage projects to successful completion, multi-task and work within deadlines.

• Can lead as well as function as part of a team.

• Able to perform in depth keyword research and industry research.

• Full understanding of Google Trends and how to leverage for search.

• Determine scope of new SEO projects in coordination with business objectives to optimize existing content and uncover new opportunities.

• Ability to perform content gap analysis and create recommendations in coordination with elements and structure of websites and web pages.

• Core skill to provide recommendations and execute/manage strategies for SEO goals – general and keyword specific.

• Core skill to implement and administer SEO functional requirements for XML sitemaps (video, news, and standard), robots.txt, canonicals, taxonomy, and schema).

• Core skill to monitor and evaluate search results and search performance across the major search channels in order to improve rankings. Local, Universal, Voice, Image.

• Core skill to monitor, analyze, and evaluate web analytics dashboards and reports in order to develop and recommend SEO strategies.

• Core skill to understand the integration opportunities between organic and paid search.

• Core skill to provide oversight and serve as quality control when working with various stakeholders.

• Create and optimize local map listings on Google My Business and citations.

• Work with the management team to ensure SEO best practices are properly implemented.

• Define requirements, tasks, acceptance criteria and resources associated to SEO strategy.

• Keep pace with SEO, search engine and internet marketing industry trends and development. 

Ideal Candidate:

• Experienced leading successful online marketing campaigns for businesses.

• Conductor certified.

• SEMrush certified.

• Strong knowledge of Google Search Console.

• Strong knowledge of Bing Webmaster Tools.

• Strong leadership skills and enthusiasm.

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

• Mastery of Local Search.

• Mastery of Image Search.

• Mastery of Video Search.

• Understanding of the key principles of Voice Search.

• Experience with Site-Search strategy.

• The ability to fill in for Paid Search strategically in an emergency.

• Able to innovate and develop new search strategies, techniques, and methods.

• Experienced with WordPress and Content • Management Systems.

• Strong knowledge of search engine guidelines, algorithms and current ranking factors.

• Strong understanding of Google Webmaster Guidelines.

• Passion for SEO and overall search marketing.

• High levels of integrity, autonomy, and self-motivation.

• Ability to clearly and effectively articulate thoughts and points.

• Attention to detail and the ability to effectively multi-task in a deadline driven atmosphere.

• Outstanding ability to think creatively, strategically and identify and resolve problems.

Future Chefs (www.futurechefs.net) prepares high-school aged teens for quality employment and postsecondary opportunities in the culinary field and elsewhere and supports them in developing broad-based transferable skills necessary for career success. With a primary focus on youth development, Future Chefs provides culinary and soft skills training and authentic hands-on experience, working with food professionals in some of Boston’s high performing restaurants and food businesses. Aspiring cooks learn in an environment that promotes a growth mindset, personal responsibility and well-being. Future Chefs’ model is based on the belief that every student is unique, flourishes in settings that provide high expectations, opportunities to grow, and caring supportive relationships. Future Chefs is a fiscally sponsored project of TSNE MissionWorks (www.tsne.org).The Temporary Culinary Arts Instructor will work collaboratively with the Future Chefs Program Team to implement curriculum for FC Prepares programming during the winter and spring of 2019- 2020. FC Prepares is a 7 week program primarily aimed at high school sophomores, which Future Chefs offers both at our own facility and also offsite at partner school locations. The position will include supervising and leading both kitchen and classroom oriented activities and tracking student progress through program-wide evaluation activities. The position will involve some recruitment with the Future Chefs Student Services team, planning and prep for once a week after school classes, and being the lead instructor for these sessions. This position could transition into permanent and/or full-time employment with Future Chefs. Who You Are You have done culinary work in a professional setting and are seeking to work in a youth-centric organization where you can share your passion for cooking and help teens and young adults develop they skills they need to succeed in life after high school. You are genuinely interested in young people’s progress, have a passion for food to share with them and are committed to working with low income urban youth. You are highly organized and a positive team player who is motivated by new challenges and a fast-paced work environment. You are able to model patience, professionalism, optimism and integrity for this group of young people. Essential Job FunctionsThe Temporary Culinary Arts Instructor will work with Future Chefs’ Work-Based Learning Leader and the Student Services Team to:Work with the Future Chefs Program staff to recruit, plan and deliver a FC Prepares course for up to 15 sophomores and juniors in winter and spring of 2019-20, as a gateway to those students enrolling in the FC Delivers program in the Fall of 2020.Ensure that data related to outcomes measurement is collected and entered on schedule.Plan and execute class materials and document class outcomes. Are you passionate about creating a diverse, thriving community for social and environmental innovators, entrepreneurs, funders, and activists? Join us to support our Boston community in driving tangible solutions to the world’s most pressing issues.
Impact Hub Boston seeks an established business and cultural leader with deep networks, who has demonstrably increased revenues, social impact, and member/staff satisfaction, to skillfully build on our strong capabilities as our next Director.

ABOUT THIS ROLEThis role is for a pragmatic leader with strong entrepreneurial skills to help Impact Hub Boston to create additional tangible impact for our local communities while growing revenues and profitability. You will be in charge of executing both long-term strategy and day-to-day management and operation of Impact Hub Boston.

ABOUT IMPACT HUB BOSTONImpact Hub Boston is a community and place that pursues a more just and sustainable world where business and profit are used in service of people and planet. We inspire, connect, and enable people and organizations to fuel entrepreneurial action.
Everyone has ideas to make the world a better place; we turn ideas into action and intention into impact. We provide access to a supportive community with resources, connections, knowledge, talent, and investments. We create places and opportunities for purpose-driven people to connect and build solutions for a better world. 
Impact Hub Boston is part of a global network of over 100 Impact Hubs across the globe, representing more than 50 countries and 17,000+ ‘change-maker’ members. Impact Hub Boston is currently housed within the Boston campus of CIC (a sister organization to Impact Hub Boston) with co-working space, private offices, and event space in the heart of downtown Boston.

GENERAL OVERVIEW OF RESPONSIBILITIESThis role has historically driven the work of making Impact Hub Boston the place where people engaged in social impact work come together to learn from, connect to, and gain inspiration from each other. This role has supported the entire Impact Hub Boston community, working within the larger framework of the global Impact Hub network (through connecting with other individual sites, the North America regional cluster, and with the global network). 
The successful applicant for this role brings with them the passion, capabilities, and track record needed to expand Impact Hub Boston’s impact in a new direction, building upon the unique strengths and attributes of this world-class community of innovators.
The Director will report to the Board of Impact Hub Boston, and currently has four direct full-time reports as well as managing contractor relationships that support finance, billing, and other temporary/periodic functions.

The general responsibilities of the Director fall into four themes:
Strategy & Leadership• Inspire our team to deliver exceptional service, drive financial success within existing and a new line of business, and work with the Board of Directors to set and manage the strategic plan,• Lead strategic initiatives, measuring performance and impact with an eye toward mitigating and managing potential business risks and vulnerabilities,• Sustain a positive, inspiring, and culturally competent work culture, supporting growth and professional development of four full-time employees and 25 volunteers + contract staff,• Build and maintain relationships with partners in delivering innovative, impactful solutions to important problems and support the work of social innovators in the Boston region,• Represent Impact Hub Boston to all stakeholders, including at outside events and speaking engagements, enhancing our public recognition and visibility. 
Operations• Provide day-to-day team management, set and monitor team KPIs and goals, and manage hiring and on-boarding of new employees,• Manage company-wide projects through all phases of development, improve existing processes and investigate improvement opportunities that use iterative planning, coordination, and automation,• Oversee member relations, manage and extend our partnership with CIC and building management, and monitor vendor relationships,• Ensure Impact Hub Boston is inviting to members of all backgrounds, oversee high-quality programming for all members, market to diverse audiences.
Finances• Manage and grow existing P&L (member growth and event revenue), prove out a new revenue opportunity, and raise capital as needed to grow the organization,• Make the case for additional investment in growth strategies to the Board of Directors and external investors, as appropriate,• Determine how to reinvest profits wisely to maximize opportunities for sustained support of our mission over time, with the assistance of the board,• Create and track annual budgets, regularly and transparently reporting to the board and staff, and analyze monthly cash flow/spending reports,• Develop a sales plan and execute marketing campaigns to continue building our local brand.
Impact• Increase members’ impact through various means, including telling our members’ stories, developing strategic partnerships, and supporting marketing, networking and sales opportunities; establish an impact advisory board,• Strengthen our engagement with important social issues in Greater Boston,• Set and measure inclusion as an important staff goal,• Report annually on our impact, by global Impact Hub survey data and B Lab Impact Assessment metrics, and report quarterly to our board.

REQUIREMENTS• Passion for our mission to inspire, connect, and enable people and organizations to fuel entrepreneurial action for a better world,• 7+ years of work experience; 4+ years of experience in a senior role and management position with 3+ direct reports,• A thorough understanding of financial management and management principles and techniques, including 2+ years managing a P&L demonstrating significant growth, and a record of success in managing budgets,• Proven experience with business scaling; enthusiasm for strategic planning, growth, and expansion, and demonstrated facility with entrepreneurial thinking in a complex environment,• Knowledgeable and passionate about Boston’s (or of a comparable urban area’s) diverse communities and neighborhoods, and the local challenges and issues that face those communities.

IDEAL CANDIDATE• Has an unwavering commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion, and a strong affinity with and dedication to our mission and values of community, inclusivity, justice, authenticity, and courage,• Believes in team and community as sources of strength; can coach and develop staff, nurture a strong community, and engender deep belief in a shared vision,• Wants to build a business that is a force for good, and is excited about enriching how we operate: with our governance, staff, environmental impact, and our impact on our customers and community,• Inspires others to enact their vision of a more just and sustainable world, using business and profit in service of people and the planet,• Brings knowledge and experience of the social enterprise sector and a high level understanding of sector trends and opportunities,• Is invigorated by the ability and opportunity to innovate, comfortable with ambiguity and can move forward in the midst of changing circumstances, rally various stakeholders in supporting Impact Hub efforts and oversee effective execution,• Has a strong appetite for networking, relationship building, and public speaking,• Wants to grow the organization (and its impact), and grow with the organization, for the next 5+ years.

COMPENSATION AND TIME EXPECTATIONSThis is a full-time salaried position with some material flexible hours around evening and occasional weekend work. Compensation of $120k, plus 100% of the cost of a premium healthcare and dental package, long and short-term disability, life insurance, 401k with partial match up to 5%, and three weeks vacation from the start (more with seniority).

ATTRACTIONS OF WORKING AT IMPACT HUB BOSTON• The opportunity to lead in the development of new approaches to solving problems that matter.• What does our staff love most about working here? Their colleagues!• The 300+ members at Impact Hub Boston are sharp, diverse, and motivated to create a better future for Boston, the US, and the world, and take part in a wide range of industries in a dynamic environment of constant learning.• Highly varied, entrepreneurial work that requires inspired vision: each day brings opportunities to bring creative solutions for a better business and positive impact.• Impact Hub Boston is centrally located to the Blue, Green, Orange, Red, and Silver MBTA lines, as well as major highways and both train stations.• Fantastic additional benefits such as unlimited access to a well-stocked kitchen (ask us about our tea wall), monthly massage at no cost, an onsite wellness program, flexible working space, and a host of discounts towards local business and well-being memberships.

Equal Opportunity Employer Impact Hub Boston is an equal opportunity employer and places a high value on workforce diversity. We strongly encourage applications from current residents of greater Boston, women, people of color, LGBTQIA individuals, individuals with disabilities, and veterans. Impact Hub policy prohibits unlawful discrimination based on race, color, creed, gender, religion, marital status, registered domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws.

The Massachusetts Technology Collaborative seeks a strong self-starter to temporarily fill the role of Outreach and Event Program Manager for the MassCyberCenter.

The mission of the MassCyberCenter is to enhance conditions for economic growth through outreach to the cybersecurity ecosystem of Massachusetts while fostering cybersecurity resiliency within the Commonwealth. The Outreach and Event Program Manager is essential to the mission center by communicating key information concerning cybersecurity activities to enhance collaboration and resiliency planning within the Commonwealth.

Since 2017, the MassCyberCenter has hosted three invitation-only Cybersecurity Forums to bring together Massachusetts world-class cybersecurity ecosystem. The Forum format is a full day of activities, starting with a luncheon, followed by break-out Trek Sessions and ending with a reception. Past forums featured Governor Charlie Baker, Massachusetts Senate President Karen Spilka, Former Defense Secretary Ash Carter, Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency Director Christopher Krebs and CEO of Rapid7 Corey Thomas. Past Forum locations included Cambridge, the Seaport, the State House and the new Rapid7 Headquarters at North Station.

The MassCyberCenter organized the first ever Massachusetts Cybersecurity Week in 2019 to coincide with the Forum in order to expand cybersecurity awareness across the state over multiple days and events. The week consisted of a Governor’s proclamation, a digital public service campaign for senior citizens as well as several events designed to examine cybersecurity issues relating to cybersecurity ecosystem diversity in the cybersecurity work force and computer science/cybersecurity programs at colleges and universities. MassTech coordinated the Baker-Politio Administration participation in several “signature” events by arranging for speakers, such as Secretary for Housing and Economic Development Mike Kennealy at the .406 Ventures investment in cybersecurity sector.

For 2020, Cybersecurity Week is being expanded to Cybersecurity Month for the entirety of October 2020, to better align Massachusetts with National Cybersecurity Awareness Month, and to allow more flexibility in key leaders’ calendars to support “signature” events. The 2020 Cybersecurity Forum will be held on a date to be determined during the Cybersecurity Month, based on Governor Baker’s availability.

Summary of Position: The Outreach and Event Program Manager is a key component of the MassCyberCenter. Only through vibrant and engaged outward facing connection to cybersecurity stakeholders will MassCyberCenter be able to strengthen cybersecurity awareness, promote collaboration within the ecosystem, and improve resiliency planning within the Commonwealth. The primary role of for this position is to plan and execute the Cybersecurity Month and Forum as well as support other efforts of the MassCyberCenter to engage stakeholders. The Cybersecurity Month and Forum are critical to developing and maintaining relationships which support other MassCyberCenter programs such as the Cyber Resilient Massachusetts Working Group, the Cybersecurity Training and Education Working Group

The Outreach and Event Program Manager will work collaboratively with the Mass Tech Collaborative Finance, Communications and Executive teams as well as an Event Contractor to organize and execute the 2020 Cybersecurity Month and Forum. The selected candidate will schedule update meetings, review vendor selection and other cost decisions by Event Contractor and coordinate actions throughout the process of planning for the upcoming events.

Additional Responsibilities include:

  Co-develop content for email campaigns, newsletters, website, marketing materials, presentations and other products to support the MassCyberCenter Support ongoing CRMWG and CTEWG management especially items which require communications activities such as website updates or communications with external stakeholders. Support Director, MassCyberCenter in presentation preparation to support on-going outreach efforts

Requirements

 Education: Bachelor’s degree required Experience: Three years of cybersecurity-related work in the public or private sector; associated marketing, strategic communications, event development or other public relations oriented experience preferred.  Knowledge and abilities:


 Excellent verbal and written communications skills Self motivated project manager with exceptional attention to detail Excellent PC skills to include knowledge of Microsoft applications to include PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook and website Collaborative and positive attitude suitable for public service
jobTitle: Temporary Outreach and Event Program Manager for MassCyberCenter

jobDetails:
Middlesex County Animal Hospital is currently looking for a associate veterinarian to join our growing practice focused on providing top notch medicine and surgery. We are an AAHA accredited well respected hospital. Our doctors are equipped with an excellent compliment of diagnostic modalities, support from an incredible staff, and are provided with boarded surgical support and scoping procedures done in-house. Diagnostics include full blood analysis, digital radiographs including dental, and quality ultrasound imaging of both the thorax and abdomen. Our diagnostic tools allow our doctors to rapidly diagnose conditions and then the entire staff becomes focused on patient treatment and care. The hospital is looking for a self motivated associate to compliment our efficient four doctor practice.

This position will focus on building a client base, providing top notch medical care through collaboration with our knowledgeable staff, and participating in a wide variety of rewarding cases. We would like an organized individual with an interest in client and staff education. This is an opportunity to join a practice with a rapidly expanding client base, a very customer friendly and accommodating philosophy, and the medicine and surgery to learn something new everyday. The hospital has a 401 K and pays for all licensure, CE stipend, and medical/dental insurance.

*Required Education: Doctor of Veterinary Medicine or equivalent degree

Please send resume and cover letter to Attn: Elise McBride

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Temporary

Additional Compensation:

Commission

Work Location:

One location

Benefits:

Health insuranceDental insuranceRetirement plan

Working days:

MondayTuesdayWednesdayThursdayFridaySaturday

Typical start time:

8AM

Typical end time:

6PM

This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:

Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneousDetail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger pictureAchievement-oriented -- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might failHigh stress tolerance -- thrives in a high-pressure environment

COMPANY SUMMARY:  We are a new healthcare model. Through our innovative model of care, we provide healthcare to our patients when they want and where they want; our visits to our patients can be as short as 60 minutes or as long as 24 hours / 7 days per week. We want to break down the walls that patients sometimes incur - by doing so, we have founded Nursing on Demand.  Would you like to be part of a new healthcare delivery model that will be like no other organization you have worked for?! We are looking for healthcare professionals who are willing to work per diem / on-call. If you are able to work 60 minutes a day or up to 24 hours days – then we are interested in speaking with you.  The care we provide can be in homes, places of work and assisted livings, as well as similar environments. We also provide temporary nurses to hospitals, SNFs and other related environments. You choose where and when you want to work.  POSITION SUMMARY:  The nurse will work with patients and their family members. They will provide patient education, treatment, and emotional support to help these individuals recover from injuries, illnesses or other healthcare concerns. Our nurses will provide care to our most cherished individuals in our community (primarily adults and the elderly). Nursing skills this position can expect to utilize, range from assisting in the everyday care of a patient who cannot care for themselves to more acute care such as: Wound care, Rx reconciliation, vital sign checks, IV medications, medication reconciliation, glucose monitoring, ADLs and more. We are committed to our patients and their families, we will provide emotional support to our patients and their families including last minute needs, overnight care and/or travel companionship just to name a few.  This is an opportunity for a conscientious, self-motivated nurse with excellent organizational skills to join us in reaching out to the community providing hands on experience to our patients and their families in our surrounding community.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities:  The nurse is essential that the nurse is able to identify patient care requirements by establishing personal rapport with the patient and their family within the scope of her/his licensure. The RN sees patients in their homes, places of work or wherever the patient would like the care delivered. We provide direct skilled nursing in the context of both scheduled and urgent visits.

Establishes a compassionate environment by providing emotional, psychological, and spiritual support to patients, and their families.
Promotes patient’s independence by establishing patient care goals; teaching patient, and family to understand condition, medications, and self-care skills and patient’s limits.
Assess a patient through obtaining the history, performing appropriate tests, making or collecting observations from the participant and caregivers.
Arranges for or directly implements care plan interventions and testing, treatment, or other provider orders.
Safely and effectively administers medications, tests, and treatments as ordered of all patient medications with appropriate authorizations by the provider.
Teaches patients' and families' health care regimens. Explains and provides information regarding disease and wellness, tests, results, medications, diet, exercise, and other aspects of the plan of care to patients.
Uses sound clinical judgment to accurately assess patient problems during visits and responds both with nursing interventions and by bringing concerns to the attention of the patient’s primary care team as appropriate
Communicates clearly and professionally with patients and caregivers
Maintain real-time documentation/reports during each visit, this should include thorough medical information.
Provide care and compassion for our elders that may have ailments – not limited to Dementia/ Alzheimer’s in our community and support the caregiver to prevent burn out.
Documentation of nursing visits
Other duties, as assigned

REQUIREMENTS: 

Current Massachusetts RN or LPN license in good standing
Current Massachusetts driver’s license and reliable transportation
Minimum of one (1) year of nursing experience preferred, but not required. VNA experience a plus.
Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills
Experience with documenting in electronic medical record strongly preferred
Must be a fluent communicator (English); bilingual is a plus. Excellent clinical skills, bedside manner, infection control, nursing skills, physiological knowledge, administering medications, medical teamwork, multi-tasking, listening, verbal communication, health promotion and maintenance.
Must be able to pass a criminal background check
Must feel comfortable seeing our clients in their homes.
jobTitle: Registered Nurse (RN) or Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN)

jobDetails:
Job Description

Grocery Clerk or Bagger



The Grocery Clerk is responsible for assisting and servicing customers in the Grocery department. He/she must have excellent customer service skills, as they may work one on one with customers in the store. He/she is responsible for following the customer satisfaction behaviors, to include being friendly, responsive, knowledgeable and passionate. He/she stocks and replenishes the Grocery shelves, Health & Beauty Care, Dairy and Frozen Foods cases and other miscellaneous areas. This includes the use of wheeled carts and/or pallet jacks to transport product from the backroom and cooler/freezer areas to the sales floor.
The Bagger / Packer is responsible for bagging groceries into either paper or plastic bags. He/she is responsible for following the customer satisfaction behaviors, to include being friendly, responsive, knowledgeable and passionate. He/she must have excellent customer service skills, as they are usually the last associate that a customer would see during their shopping trip.

Job Description:

 Description:

This candidate will be the Product Owner for a major Financial clients' Services team. The candidate will manage and administer product planning, design, development, documentation, and execution throughout the product lifecycle. They will also gather and prioritize product and customer requirements, define the product vision, and works closely with cross-functional groups.

Top 3 Must Have Skills:

1 Product Experience (preferably agile)

2 Some level of technical expertise – engineering background (not mandatory to be engineering, science, some aptitude in technical filed)

3 Aptitude for business side – understanding of how products work, how products work against competitors, features should leverage, interacting with different orgs to understand products

Job Description –

Max travel once a month but more likely once every 3 months

Opportunity to work in a great team, fintech experience.

Manages and administers product planning, design, development, documentation, and execution throughout the product lifecycle. Gathers and prioritizes product and customer requirements, defines the product vision, and works closely with R&D, engineering, sales, marketing, operations, and support to conform to the company’s quality system procedures for design control and to ensure revenue and customer satisfaction goals are met. Ensures that the product, and possibly the marketing efforts, supports the company's overall strategy and goals.: Defines the product strategy and roadmap. Delivers product requirement documents and marketing requirement documents with prioritized features and corresponding justification. Runs beta and pilot programs with early-stage products and samples. Develops the core positioning and messaging for the product. Performs product demos to customers. Maintains expertise with respect to the competition. Acts as a leader within the company. May work with external third parties to assess partnerships and licensing opportunities. May set pricing to meet revenue and profitability goals, develop sales tools and collateral, and brief and train the sales force.

NOTE: this is categorized as Sales/Marketing but would like someone who has IT background (gave example of Engineering, Comp Science, or other IT field)

This supports Consumer credit project. Specific to US and UK revolving credit products. In market products.

Start Date: 5/11 or sooner;

Daily Schedule: M-F 9-5

Typical Task Breakdown/Rhythm:

Working with engineering team writing stories, managing agile ceremonies, working with UX team to build out new products/features and new ones.

Years of Experience: 3-5 (Fairly Jr but has a few years exp in produc management)

Degrees or Certifications: Bachelor

Best vs. Average: Financial Tech Exp, having more product experience is better

Company: TridentCare

Hate being stuck in an office all day? Come drive for TridentCare! No commercial driver's license necessary! Just a valid Basic (Class D) Driver's license is required!

TridentCare is seeking a driver to perform the safe and timely delivery and pick-up of specimens, supplies and reports. For this position, applicants are expected to use their own vehicle, and will be reimbursed mileage. No commercial driver's license classification is necessary.

POSITION SUMMARY

The Driver is responsible for the safe and timely delivery and pick up of specimens, supplies and reports.

Essential Position Duties

¨ Delivers and picks up specimens as directed in a manner consistent with CLIA and OSHA standards and company policy.

¨ Delivers supplies and/or literature as needed by clients.

¨ Answers pages in a timely manner.

¨ Ensures proper, secure stabilization of sensitive specimens during transportation in accordance with CLIA regulations and company policy.

¨ Notifies supervisor and/or dispatch in a timely manner of any problems with equipment or vehicles.

¨ Operates vehicle in a safe manner in accordance with company policy and state regulations.

¨ Reports accidents, injuries and safety risks promptly.

¨ Adheres to TridentCare company dress code.

¨ Meets company attendance standards and reports to work on time.

¨ Identifies and pursues self improvement needs.

¨ Seeks coaching/mentoring when appropriate.

¨ Performs other duties, including cleaning of company vehicles, as assigned

Compliance Responsibilities

¨ Complies with applicable legal requirements, standards, and procedures including, but not limited to, those within the Compliance Process and Code of Conduct.

¨ Participates in required orientation, Compliance and HIPAA training programs.

¨ Cooperates with monitoring and audit functions and investigations.

¨ Participates, as requested, in process improvement responsibilities.

POSITION QUALIFICATIONS

Core Competencies/Skill Sets

¨ Demonstrates good verbal and written communication skills.

¨ Interacts effectively with employees, managers and clients.

¨ Open to feedback from others.

Professional Experience/Educational Requirements

¨ High School diploma or GED certificate.

¨ At least two years of driving experience.

¨ Acceptable driving record according to the standards set by the U.S. Laboratories policy.

Certification/Licensure

¨ Valid driver’s license.

Working Conditions and Physical Requirements

The employee is required to have visual and hearing acuity (with or without the aid of mechanical devices) sufficient to perform the essential duties of the position.

Shift: PT / Temporary

8:00 a.m.- 12:00 p.m. Monday-Friday; Every other Saturday and Sunday, Rotating holidays.
