Job Description:

 Be part of a startup-minded product development initiative within one of the world's most admired companies. Interface design for user experiences - facing customers experience is essential. This is a full-time, 40 hour per week assignment with our client, a global online marketplace. Assignment has excellent healthcare benefits (well-subsidized health coverage, vision and dental plus a 401K).



	4 years experience (between UI/UX, Interaction Design and Product), with the ability to cut/deliver assets to developers, and assemble low-medium fidelity click or tap-throughs for testing purposes
Workflow design examples or case studies essential. Best case is multi-step workflows.
Mobile UI Design experience - best case is native application experience
Proficient in Sketch for interface design (Flinto is a nice to have)
Proactively stay aligned with manager/design lead on latest design direction, priorities, and next steps
Follow requirements and feedback to extend existing design assets into new workflows
Deliver detailed design documentation and refined design standards to developers and partners
Experience designing mobile, web applications a plus
Experience designing tools for business or operations, a plus

Specifically, you will:

• Deliver user-centered designs (including wireframes, high-fidelity mockups, information architecture diagrams, interaction specifications, and prototypes), informed by customer research, and market analysis across multiple devices and platforms

• Participate in the planning process for new features and projects while collaborating with an agile, multi-disciplinary team

• Introduce, develop, and ensure best design practices, processes and communicate quality expectations organizationally

• Own the production of world-class deliverables and documents for presentation to engineers, managers, peer design teams, and senior executives

REQUIRED SKILLS

• Bachelor's degree in design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or equivalent professional experience

• At least 4 years as a user experience designer, interaction designer, or similar role

• A portfolio of work demonstrating experience creating great scalable user-centered design solutions

• Proficiency in a variety of UX tools such Sketch and interactive prototyping tools.

PREFERRED SKILLS

• Demonstrated ability to deliver large-scale strategic design initiatives with a bias toward scalable systems and patterns

• Strong design thinking, human centered design skills with expertise in user-centric design processes and execution across all levels (high-level strategy through execution)

• Demonstrated design expertise creating highly usable designs and multi-device design layouts with a propensity towards simplification

• Demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a team

• Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills

• Have designed products with combined web UI and API use cases

We're looking for OTR Class A Hazmat Drivers in any of the following locations:


Wrentham, MANYCNew JerseyAlbany, NYBaltimore, MDEastern PA

About You 

The person we are looking for enjoys driving over the road with the comforts of being home on the weekends. You are a road warrior, and a people person with the ability to maintain good relationships with customers while ensuring that work is performed efficiently. You are proud of your strong safety record and look are always looking to grow your knowledge.

Position Summary

In this position, you would travel to customer locations to assist them with their regulated waste needs. You will sort, package, document, secure, and then transport their waste to a temporary storage or treatment facility. Customers would include retail stores, pharmacies, and industrial sites. Examples of waste you would handle are lighters, batteries, oils, cleaners, over the counter medicine, bleach, vinegar, paints, aerosols, other chemicals, and contaminated soils to name a few.

After checking in you can expect to:

Review your daily route that given to you by the Transportation Coordinator the week prior.You will be able to check your truck for needed supplies and placards.Proceed on your scheduled route with safety in the front of your mind.While making your stops at the retail stores, you will exercise your customer service skills.Operate class A trucks.Visit base customers regularly, while enjoying a nice change of pace with seasonal projects.Maintain electronic log and documentation of manifests and work orders on your tablet.

What you need to apply

High School Diploma or GED equivalentCDL Class A , with hazardous endorsement preferredGood driving record with less than 3 violations in the last 3 yearsBasic knowledge of smart phones and computersKnowledge of DOT, EPA, and DEA regulationsAbility to pass pre-employment background checks and drug screeningTravel may apply based off of specific contracts or projects

For your hard work

Tuition reimbursement after six monthsOpportunity for professional growthEmployer paid certifications and training100% employer paid medical option for youPaid Time OffCash Recognition Programs

Find out more at http://www.usecology.com

Education & Experience

Six Sigma Green Belt preferred.

This is a full time 3rd shift 40 hour/week position. 4 ten hour shifts.NOTE: Overnight Shift shifts pay an additional $4.00 shift differentialToday, March 18th we are hiring. Angell has an opening on evening shift in our Emergency/CCU department for a Certified Veterinary Technician. This is an essential role in the daily operations our fast paced ER Services Department which is currently open to Emergency and Emergent patients. This position qualifies for a $2,000 sign on bonus for new hire Certified Veterinary Technicians.Angell, founded in 1915, is recognized internationally as a leader in animal medicine and has the reputation as one of the finest veterinary teaching hospitals in North America. Angell serves the greater Boston and scenic New England area as a primary care facility, a 24-hour emergency hospital, and as a tertiary referral center. We offered the very first veterinary internship in the world beginning in 1941, running continuously to present day. Angell was instrumental in establishing specialty veterinary medicine. Our hospital has a long history of providing training not only to veterinary interns and residents but also to veterinary students and the veterinary community at large.Consider working at our non-profit hospital with State-of-the-art equipment, using your advanced skills in our CCU. Our Technicians are proficient in;-Wound Vac maintenance in post-operative patients-Blood transfusions including auto-transfusions, emergency blood donations for patients-Tracheostomy tube (temporary and permanent) care/maintenance-Ventilator patient care-Continuous Closed Chest Drainage Systems-Chest tube care/maintenance-Central line placement-Urinary catheter placement, care/maintenance-Anesthesia monitoring for minor emergency procedures-Nasal oxygen cannula placement and management-Assisting with thoracentesis, abdominocentesis, pericardiocentesis-Assisting with hemodialysis patient care-Exotics care-Arterial blood sampling and catheters-Management of multiple types of feeding tubes including nasogastric, nasoesophageal, esophageal, and PEG tubes-Total Parenteral Nutrition (TPN) and Partial Parenteral Nutrition (PPN)Working at one of the most acclaimed veterinary practices in the country, caring for approximately 90,000 animals per year you will find our CCU fast paced and challenging working alongside our compassion and professional CCU team. At Angell we offer full time hours (40 per week) and additional pay for overtime worked, competitive pay and benefits package, free on-site Boston parking, and employee discounts for pet health care.The MSPCA-Angell is a challenging and progressive environment where teamwork and camaraderie is a priority. • Minimum of 6 months ECC experience is required.
• VTS certification preferred and encouraged to join our 6+ VTS(ECC) technicians

To be hired as a technician, you must be a Certified/Licensed Veterinary Technician (CVT)

Title

Clinical Research Assistant II

10-Feb-2020

Department

Medicine-General Pediatrics

AutoReqId

52347BR

Status

Full-Time

Standard Hours per Week

40

Shift

Day

Job Posting DescriptionThe Division of General Pediatrics at Boston Children's Hospital is seeking an enthusiastic, intelligent, and hardworking individual to work on grant-funded research within Dr. Landrigan’s research group. The group’s research focuses on developing, evaluating, and disseminating interventions to improve patient safety through structured communication, training, and teamwork using the Eisenberg award-winning I-PASS program (http://ipassstudygroup.com/) which has been published in the New England Journal, the British Medical Journal, and the Journal of the American Medical Association. The research assistant will provide project support for the I-PASS suite of projects (https://www.jointcommissionjournal.com/article/S1553-7250(17)30176-9/pdf). This includes projects to improve: (a) resident-physician communication at change of shift (I-PASS Resident Handoffs and CRICO Mentored Implementation of I-PASS, https://www.nejm.org/doi/full/10.1056/NEJMsa1405556); (b) family-provider communication (Patient and Family Centered I-PASS, https://www.bmj.com/content/363/bmj.k4764); and (c) transitions of care at hospital discharge (Hospital to Home).

The Clinical Research Assistant II will be responsible for project support, data coordination, and keeping IRB documentation up-to-date. They will also support manuscript submissions, presentations, and other scholarship opportunities with the possibility of co-authorship. They may additionally assist with other related projects in the group.

This Clinical Research Assistant II will be responsible for:


Conducting literature searches and summarize findings.
Providing meeting support (e.g., tend to logistics, prepare materials, take minutes).
Assisting with ongoing data collection efforts (e.g., recruit participants, conduct surveys, abstract patient charts, obtain hospital administrative data).
Conducting preliminary quantitative (e.g., claims, survey) and/or qualitative (e.g., interview) analyses.
Supporting clinical research reporting for data review, quality control checks, and interim and final analysis.
Providing data coordination and data management services.
Filing human subjects review board protocols and amendments.
Aggregating data and aid in data cleaning and management.
Preparing graphs, charts and other visuals.
Supporting the writing of abstracts, poster presentations and research articles.
Assisting with grant writing, preparation and submissions.
Other duties as needed.


To qualify, you must have:


A Bachelor’s degree in science, math, psychology or related fields and a minimum of one year of relevant work experience. A Master’s degree in public health or epidemiology preferred but not required.
Interest in patient safety, quality improvement, transitions of care, communication, or family-centered care.
Analytical skills to gather and interpret data in an organized, accurate and timely manner.
High proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel (including Pivot Tables), and PowerPoint required.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

GENERAL SUMMARY OF POSITION:

Kelly Scientific Resources is searching for a QC Analyst Level II to work with one of our best clients in Boston, MA. The Quality Control Analyst II is responsible for conducting routine and non-routine analysis of in process, finished formulations, and clinical samples according to standard operating procedures. Compiles data for documentation of test procedures and prepares reports. Calibrates and maintains lab equipment. Assist in developing testing methods. Reviews data obtained for compliance to specifications and reports abnormalities. Revises and updates standard operating procedures as needed. Performs special projects on analytical and instrument problem solving. Applies knowledge of good manufacturing practices and good laboratory practices on a daily basis. This position requires mandatory second and third shift rotations (about once every 6 weeks) to support 24 hour aseptic filling operations. The position requires occasional weekend sampling.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:



	Perform product release and clinical assays in the QC Laboratory as set forth in SOPs.

Perform preliminary review and sign-off of assays

Perform cell culture to maintain QC cell lines

Perform assays including but not limited to PCR, ELISA and other cell based assays

Prepare and test reagents used in assays as needed.

Organize, compile data and assist in the analysis of data by statistical procedures as requested by Laboratory Supervisor.

Generate, maintain and trend assay parameter data for designated assays.

Troubleshoot assay problems with Laboratory Supervisor.

Participate in writing and revising SOPs. Perform annual review of SOPs.

Assists in the writing of change controls and incident/deviation reports.

Assist in the development of testing methods.

Assist in the qualification of new controls, standards and reagents.

Maintain log books related to inventory and equipment.

Ensure labs are clean and safe (in compliance with cGMP), and properly stocked.

Makes detailed observations, analyzes data and interprets results. Prepares technical reports, data summaries or protocols.

Performs other additional job related duties as required. 

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:



	Requires a bachelor’s degree in Biology or related field with a minimum 2 years of relevant experience or equivalent

Ability to follow instructions precisely, recognize deviations, and recommend corrective action within scope of training

Prior experience in a cGMP/cGLP regulated environment. Working knowledge of applicable FDA, cGMP, and cGLP regulations

Capable of moderately complex troubleshooting

Computer literate and proficient in MS Word, Excel and other relevant electronic systems

Strong problem solving, time management and organizational skills. Demonstrated ability to multitask and consistently meet deadlines

Possesses well developed attention to detail, ability to maintain accurate records and excellent proofreading skills

Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to communicate effectively with others and to train others.

Demonstrated initiative through past experience

Ability to work effectively both independently and as a member of a team

Demonstrated proficiency in the following techniques required: ELISA, cell culture, and animal injections and procedures.

Ability to lift up to 50 lbs using proper lifting technique

Requires ability to work flexible and, at times, extended hours to meet business needs

Must be able to carry out the essential functions of this position, with reasonable accommodation if disabled

SUPERVISION RECEIVED:

Reports to the Manager of QC or designee

SUPERVISION EXERCISED:

May supervise junior level personnel

ENVIRONMENTAL WORKING CONDITIONS:

Job may require working with hazardous and infectious materials. Clinical Duties: Physicians are expected to remain privileged and practicing in their specialty field. The exact privileges and procedures for a particular provider will be approved by the Professional Standards Board. All physicians must meet the following standards:

Patient Care: Practitioners are expected to provide patient care that is compassionate, appropriate, and effective for the promotion of health, prevention of illness, treatment of disease, and care at the end of life.

Medical/Clinical Knowledge: Practitioners are expected to demonstrate knowledge of established and evolving biomedical, clinical and social sciences, and the application of their knowledge to patient care and the education of others.

Clinical Judgment: To ensure practice-based learning and improvement, practitioners are expected to be able to use scientific evidence and methods to investigate, evaluate, and improve patient care.

Interpersonal & Communication Skills: Practitioners are expected to demonstrate interpersonal and communication skills that enable them to establish and maintain professional relationships with patients, families, and other members of the health care team.

Professionalism: Practitioners are expected to demonstrate behaviors that reflect a commitment to continuous professional development, ethical practice, and understanding and sensitivity to diversity, and a responsible attitude toward their patients, their profession.

Systems-Based Practice: Practitioners are expected to demonstrate both an understanding of the contexts and systems in which health care is provided, and the ability to apply this knowledge to improve optimizing health care.

Note: We will accept applications for this occupation on an ongoing basis and qualifications will be reviewed biweekly; qualified applicants will be considered as vacancies become available. Applicants need not re-apply once the application is referred to the selecting official.

For more than 50 years, TranSystems has provided engineering and architectural planning, design and construction solutions to enhance the movement of goods and people across today’s integrated transportation infrastructure. Headquartered in Kansas City, Mo., its professionals in more than 30 offices throughout the U.S. perform a broad range of services to all sectors of the transportation and federal marketplaces. Services are delivered throughout the asset life cycle, from concept to construction to long-term operations, maintenance and rehabilitation.

Come Grow With Us!

TranSystems provides the planning, design and construction oversight for the transportation networks that drive our nation, fueling the movement of people and goods on roads, rails, waterways and through the air. As a 100% employee owned company, we are committed to providing opportunities for growing careers by developing and advancing projects for the transportation economy.

TranSystems’ Boston office, located in the heart of downtown, provides transportation engineering services on highway, bridge and rail projects throughout New England and across the country. The Boston office Highway & Traffic team works on a wide variety of projects: intersection designs that incorporate traffic signals and roundabouts; roadway corridor and bridge rehabilitation projects that enhance bicycle and pedestrian accommodations and introduce highway safety measures; interchange reconstructions that modernize traffic operations.

The Boston office has an immediate opening for a Civil Transportation Engineer with 0 - 2 years of experience. This candidate will work on a wide variety of tasks with the Highway & Traffic team including designing roadway alignments and profiles, developing roadway cross sections, and preparing construction and temporary traffic control plans.

General Duties & Responsibilities

  Prepare design calculations.   Research different design options and present findings.   Prepare contract drawings and exhibits.   Contribute to project reports and specifications.   Prepare construction cost estimates.   Receive instructions from Project Manager as to the general results expected for tasks.   Communicate frequently with Project Manager, Supervisor, and project team members.   Keep Project Manager informed of workload, provide updates on project progress.   Communicate with, and attend meetings with: clients, project teams, and other project stakeholders.   Ensure accuracy of engineering design and plans, quality presentation, thoroughness and follow-through, and conformance to budgets, schedules, and company standards.   Broaden professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies. 

Basic Qualifications:

  Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering from a 4-yr accredited college or university   Working knowledge of MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, etc.)   Knowledge of engineering design packages such as AutoCAD and/or MicroStation   No relocation assistance provided

Preferred Qualifications: 





  Experience working with MassDOT and other local transportation agencies   Experience working with engineering civil design packages such as AutoCAD Civil3D, Microstation InRoads, Microstation Geopak, and/or Microstation OpenRoads   EIT Certification

DescriptionThe Exhibit Interpretation Program offers hands-on, inquiry-based learning experiences for Museum visitors throughout the Exhibit Halls. Our goal is to engage visitors in investigations that encourage them to develop the skills of scientific inquiry, engineering design, and mathematics. Volunteers in the Exhibit Interpretation Program help support a variety of programs within the department. For starters, volunteers may find themselves guiding visitors as they examine fossils or animal skulls, investigate the properties of sound, explore invisible light with an infrared camera, or use a portable ultrasound. Volunteers may also assist school groups with field-trip activities for our Exhibit Investigations program, a program that provides teachers with an opportunity to request a themed exploration of an exhibit area.Training


Attend a New Volunteer Orientation sessionComplete a department-specific Museum orientation during first 2 months of regular volunteer shiftsWork with Museum staff during regular shifts to learn investigation activities and develop interpretation skillsAttend weekly briefings at the beginning of each volunteer shift and participate in ongoing training and interpretation skill development
Responsibilities


Offer great guest service by answering visitors' questions, sharing knowledge of the Museum's offerings, and striving to ensure that each visitor's experience is enjoyable.Create a welcoming environment for learning by greeting visitors with enthusiasm and responding to their individual needs and interestsEngage visitors in activities that get them excited about science and technology and encourage them to use science inquiry, engineering design, and mathematics skillsHelp support department programs as needed, including providing Drop-In Activities as required for the Museum's Daily Schedule, supporting school requests for the Exhibit Investigations program, and providing hands-on activities in temporary exhibits;

Minimum Qualifications


At least 14 years of ageExcellent communication and customer service skillsInterest in science, engineering, and/or education and a motivation to learn moreDemonstrated enthusiasm, initiative, and reliabilityWillingness to work with visitors of all ages and levels of interest or ability
Commitment


We ask that you give us one 3.5-hour shift per week for at least four to six months.

jobDetails:
The following is a list of essential job functions which may be found in varying combinations in a Community Health Nurse's (CHN) daily work activities. Other duties may be assigned.

EVALUATION AND CARE PLAN

At the time of a referral to the BVNA for services, the Admission CHN must visit the patient and complete a comprehensive assessment of the patient's/family's medical/psychosocial status, nutritional needs and safety. The CHN will verify the doctor and insurance coverage. When the CHN is unable to schedule a visit according to the frequency noted on the physicians order, the CHN must notify the patient and his/her physician. This information must be documented in the patients record. The CHN establishes a plan of treatment which includes the various services required to maintain the patient safely in the home or other residence(s). The Plan of Treatment includes quantifiable goals based on desired outcomes. Involves patient/family in the development of the Plan of Treatment. Makes appropriate referral(s) for home health aide, social and/or rehabilitation service(s). It is the responsibility of the CHN to review the proposed Plan of Treatment before it is sent to the physician for signature.

SKILLED NURSING CARE

The CHN visits the patient to perform nursing services covering a wide range of skilled nursing care as outlined in the Clinical Policies and Procedures. They include, but are not limited to:

- Instruction on medication reconciliation and plan for any discrepancies

- Cardiovascular treatments

Skin treatments

Gastrointestinal treatments

Genitourinary treatments

Pulmonary treatments

Musculoskeletal treatments

- Other Treatments

The CHN may be required to transfer patients as needed, using hoyer lifts, wheelchairs, sliding boards, hospital beds, and/or draw sheet transfers. In such cases where a twoperson assist is required, the CHN will attempt to schedule the visit during a Home Health Aide's scheduled visit or may call upon a family member, if and when possible.

PATIENT AND FAMILY EDUCATION

The CHN will identify the educational needs of patient/ significant other(s) through the use of the assessment tool. The CHN will instruct patient/significant other(s) in a manner that is understandable to the patient/significant other(s). Education will include, but is not limited to: disease process, prognosis, medications, procedures and treatments, personal care, emergency plans, infection control and safety. Initially and during subsequent home visits, the CHN will assess current knowledge and ability of the patient/significant other(s) and the need for reeducation regarding the specific knowledge and/or skills required to meet the patient's ongoing health care needs. The CHN will observe the patient/significant other perform return demonstration(s) and document the patient/significant others ability to perform what was taught to the patient/significant other.

The CHN will begin discharge planning at the patients first visit by explaining that the service(s) provided by the Brockton VNA are intermittent and temporary.

The CHN will prepare the patient/significant other(s) for discharge with verbal and written information regarding community services, medication usage and followup visits for medical care.

COORDINATION AND SUPERVISION OF PATIENT CARE

The Admission CHN will be responsible for the initiation of the patients home health care needs and will collaborate with other members of the multidisciplinary team who are involved in the care of the patient and document same in the clinical record. He/she is responsible for communicating with the Case Manager or designee as well as other disciplines regarding the case The CHN will participate in and document case conferences. The CHN will assure that information regarding patient care is relayed to appropriate personnel so that optimal patient care will be provided during his/her absence. Assists in the orientation of new staff and in the education of students. Attends and participates in team meetings. Obtains minutes of missed team meeting(s) and follows up with Manager if he/she has any questions. Attends internal/external in-services and presents information to peers.

MAINTAINS TIMELY AND ACCURATE DOCUMENTATION

The CHN will document on the day of the visit all care provided including clinical findings and education provided to the patient/significant other(s). The CHN will submit on a timely basis all required documents in accordance with Agency documentation guidelines.

The CHN will complete all documentation according to Agency guidelines.

The CHN will abide by Agency policy to submit the OASIS Assessment within 24 hours for a Start of Care. The OASIS will be completed accurately according to Agency and OASIS guidelines.

Job Type: Full-time

License:

Laboratory Technologist responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:

Reporting test results conforming to established procedures.

For a list of potential chemical hazards, see appropriate MSDS sheet.

Knowledge of the principles, methods, materials, equipment, and techniques of medical technology.

Knowledge of the principles of chemistry, biology, and bacteriology as related to medical technology.

Some knowledge of recent developments in the field of medical technology.

Ability to instruct subordinate technologist in areas of medical laboratory testing.

Ability to perform assigned tasks according to prescribed procedures and to make accurate observations and records of tests results.

Skill in the use of medical laboratory equipment.

Analytical thinking and communication skills.

Strong computer, scientific, and organizational skills

Excellent communication (oral and written) and attention to detail

Ability to work independently and as part of a team, self-motivation, adaptability, and a positive attitude

Ability to learn new techniques, perform multiple tasks simultaneously, keep accurate records, follow instructions, and comply with company policies

Basic Minimum Qualifications:



	Bachelor’s degree in a chemical, physical, biological or clinical laboratory science, or medical technology from an accredited institution.

Authorization to work in the United States indefinitely without restriction or sponsorship

Kelly Scientific is seeking candidates for a Cell Therapy Manufacturing Manager position with our innovative and dynamic client in the Waltham, Massachusetts area!

Summary:The individual will be responsible for helping to drive the on-time-delivery of manufacturing start-up activities for all aspects of cell therapy manufacturing and, contribute to ontime-delivery of manufacturing operations for the multiproduct cGMP cell and gene therapy site. The incumbent will be responsible for a manufacturing team performing routine cGMP manufacture of a diverse portfolio of autologous and allogenic cell therapies and provide leadership across both cell therapy and viral vector manufacturing. The individual should be a motivated self-starter eager to contribute to building a manufacturing operation unparalleled in its capabilities and expertise, have a willingness and aptitude for adoption of new technology, an ability to build relationships and work effectively in a cross-functional team, and commitment to the highest safety and quality standards.

Responsibilities:

• Be a cell therapy technical expert for cGMP manufacturing and aseptic processing

• Be integral in providing hands-on technical, organizational, and leadership expertise to the start-up activity for a state-of-the-art cGMP cell and gene therapy manufacturing facility including but not limited to equipment selection, SOPs, batch records, reports, risk assessments, material ordering/management

• Provide daily management oversight of product’s production flow / value stream ensuring end to end the internal supply chain delivers product timely and right-first-time, stalwart adherence to driving culture that improves operational and quality metrics

• Work with a cross-functional team of process development, engineering, quality, etc. for the development of cGMP-appropriate, scalable cell therapy manufacturing processes

• Engage in proactive relationships with partners including acting as key client interface representing operational interests in both tactical and strategic meetings

• Lead operational staff, develop staff capabilities, create a culture of safety, continuous improvement and training objectives, and compliance

• Establish key performance indicators in alignment with individual, department, and company goals, maintain and report organizational metrics

• Proactively identify and escalate key risks and issues to manufacturing line and site leadership team. Organize and lead ad hoc cross functional teams to develop risk mitigation plans and/or manage complex operational issues

• Work effectively with cross functional teams comprised of process sciences, development, facilities & engineering, tech ops, quality control, quality assurance, to ensure right-firsttime technology transfer

• Identify risks and propel continuous improvements in development and manufacturing processes through technological innovation and alignment with regulatory requirements for clinical and commercial vector manufacturing

• Ensure high levels of communication with team, support resources, and management regarding issue identification and resolution; develop formal communication protocols and tools including progress tracking systems, dashboards, and management reports, and any other product specific information as needed.

• Works closely with the production staff to troubleshoot process and equipment problems

• Works closely with senior management to initiate new production projects and assists in developing processes/techniques to meet contract objectives

• Support the team in defining and executing technical strategies

• Work closing with Quality Assurance and Process Sciences to proactively resolve issues such as deviations, CAPAs, Change Controls

• Review completed batch records. Develop training material, update curricula, close training gaps, and support the initial and ongoing training of staff

• Proactively identify opportunities for improvements in process, safety, quality, and cost

Requirements:

• Bachelor’s degree in biological science(s) field or related engineering, advanced degree preferred

• 6-10 years of experience in cGMP biotech manufacturing

• 6-8 years of cell therapy manufacturing experience

• 4-6 years of project owner/management experience

• 4-6 years of proven leadership experience

• Experience with MES and integrated automation in manufacturing preferred

• Outstanding communication skills (verbal and written)

• Excellent computer and word processing skills including Microsoft Excel, Powerpoint, and Word

• Experience with some or all of the following; cGMP manufacture and/or process development for CAR T, TCR, NK, cellular therapies

• Advanced understanding of primary cell culture and experience with equipment such as CliniMACS, CliniMACS Prodigy, LOVO, WAVE bioreactors such as Xuri, G-Rex system

Type: W2 Assignment

Length: Start with 06 months (Long term Assignment)

Pay rate: $70 - $86 per hour

Job Description:

This position will drive financial systems solutions across the global ERP platform. It will require an individual who is focused on building strong partnerships and delivering the best possible outcomes to their stakeholders. They must be process oriented, with the ability to assess both technical and functional considerations and apply that accordingly. The ideal candidate should possess an accomplished track record combined with the tenacity, self-confidence and proven ability to continually grow and contribute to a global business. She/he must feel comfortable working in, as well as embracing, an environment that is both changing and challenging. The ideal candidate will be a self-motivated, team player who will bring instant credibility with demonstrated ability to communicate across all levels of the organization. She/he must be technically astute with the ability to troubleshoot complex applications with multiple integrations. She/he must be a “quick read” in regard to new concepts and technologies.

• Partner with business, technical development, app admin teams for GAP analysis, business requirements, technical development, patch application and ensuring successful delivery of Finance projects

• Ensure processes are continuously followed and refined to maintain stability - execute all activities following organizational controls and processes (i.e. software development life-cycle (SDLC), change management, etc)

• Collaborate across the global IT Finance team and IT Supply Chain on all process, support, delivery, etc.

• Execute technical activities such as system configuration, data extract/load, report development, etc.

• Business partner, representing IT Finance, and contribute to ensuring successful implementation of financial projects.

• Participate in estimation and sizing of potential efforts.

• Assist in the process to educate and train local finance user community on IT Finance applications

At Biogen we focus not only on results but also on how we achieve our success. As part of our Culture of Excellence we stress the value of collaboration as we strive to Care Deeply, Work Fearlessly, and Change Lives.

• At least 6 years of experience working hands-on and leading efforts involving Oracle EBS Finance applications 6+ years IT/Industry Experience

• Techno-functional experience in several Oracle EBS (R12) finance data architectures, OPM Costing a must

• Oracle SQL knowledge

• Integration experience, using APIs & XML templates

• Working knowledge of Oracle supply chain, Oracle process manufacturing modules is preferred

• Thorough understanding of technical and functional aspects of Oracle EBS Order-to-Cash and Cost Accounting

• Has the ability to work with users of all levels to identify requirements and deliver timely results.

• Ability to analyze business processes and translate business needs into requirements and solution design documents. Must be able to resolve business process gaps using standard software functionality.

• Strong understanding of information systems, business processes and measures of success

• Proven commitment to customer care, system availability, reliability and issue resolution. This can include off-hours and on-call support to resolve system incidents

• Analytical/Creative Problem Solving

• Knowledge in Data Analytics tools such as Tableau is a plus

• Strong written and verbal communication skills

• Flexibility to work independently with minimal supervision, or collaborate on a multi-disciplinary teams

• Solid understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle desired

• Experience in a biotechnology/pharmaceutical company preferred and is a definite plus

• Prior experience in a SOX environment preferred and is a definite plus

Education

• Bachelors or Master’s degree in Business, Computer Science, or related field

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s Degree Acceptance and enrollment in a graduate program; Knowledge and understanding of research methodologies; both qualitative and quantitative; Ability to synthesize information and write reports;Ability to participate as a positive team player; Strong organizational and communication skills; Knowledge and understanding of diversity and an ability to work effectively with a wide variety of people. 

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Experience working in higher education.

• Cover letter that addresses the applicant’s capabilities and experiences.

Nurse I Level III - An ADN or Diploma in Nursing and approximately 2-3 years of nursing practice/experience; OR an ADN or Diploma in Nursing and a Bachelor's degree in a related field and approximately 1-2 years of nursing practice/experience; OR a BSN with approximately 1-2 years of nursing practice/experience; OR a Master's degree in nursing (MSN) or related field with a BSN and no additional nursing practice/experience.

Nurse II - A BSN with approximately 2-3 years of nursing practice/experience; OR ADN or Diploma in Nursing and a Bachelor's degree in a related field and approximately 2-3 year's of nursing practice/experience; OR a Master's degree in nursing or related field with a BSN and approximately 1-2 year's of nursing practice/experience; OR a Doctoral degree in nursing or meets basic requirements for appointment and has doctoral degree in a related field with no additional nursing practice/experience required.

Nurse III - Master's degree in nursing or related field with BSN and approximately 2-3 year's of nursing practice/experience; OR a Doctoral degree.

Reference: VA Regulations, specifically VA Handbook 5005, Part II, Appendix G-6 Nurse Qualification Standard. This can be found in the local Human Resources Office.

Basic Qualifications

Additional Qualifications

Previous post-graduate industrial experience with a focus on product development is strongly preferred.

PhD in biological or medical science is strongly preferred.

Highly desirable additions include: post-doctoral training; knowledge of and experience with endothelial biology and IPS technology, antibody engineering, microfluidic assays, proteomics, transcriptomics/RNA-Seq, and target selection and validation. Extensive experience with mammalian cell culture is required. Expertise or experience with some or all of: antibody discovery and functional assays, cell-based qPCR/TaqMan, ELISA, Western blot, enzymatic assays, imaging, flow cytometry, and mouse experiments in strongly preferred. Ability to work well independently and supervise and train research associates, interns and students is essential, as is the ability to collaborate with a multidisciplinary group in a matrix organization, using influence rather than authority over colleagues. Excellent written and oral communication skills are essential. The candidate should be highly motivated, detail-oriented, organized.

Additional InformationThe mission of the Wyss Institute for Biologically Inspired Engineering at Harvard University is to transform human healthcare and the environment by emulating the way nature builds. Developed as an alliance between Harvard and other premier academic and clinical partner institutions, Institute faculty and staff collaborate in high-risk, fundamental research and science-driven technology development. A major focus of the Institute is to translate the technologies developed by its faculty and staff into commercial products and therapies through collaborations with clinical investigators and establishment of corporate alliances and launching startup companies. For more information, visit: http://wyss.harvard.edu/.

Harvard offers an outstanding benefits package including:

Time Off: 3 - 4 weeks paid vacation, paid holiday break, 12 paid sick days, 11.5 paid holidays, and 3 paid personal days per year.Medical/Dental/Vision: We offer a variety of excellent medical plans, dental & vision plans, all coverage begins as of your start date.Retirement: University-funded retirement plan contributions from 5% to 15% of eligible compensation, based on age and earnings with full vesting after 3 years of service.Tuition Assistance Program: Competitive tuition assistance program, $40 per class at the Harvard Extension School and discounted options through participating Harvard grad schools.Transportation: Harvard offers a 50% discounted MBTA pass as well as additional options to assist employees in their daily commute.Wellness options: Harvard offers programs and classes at little or no cost, including stress management, massages, nutrition, meditation and complimentary health services.Harvard access to athletic facilities, libraries, campus events and many discounts throughout metro Boston.


Visa sponsorship may be available for this position.

Department

Wyss Institute

Pre-Employment Screening

Education, Identity

Schedule

Monday through Friday, 9am - 5pm

Job Function

Research

Job-Specific Responsibilities

The successful candidate will be responsible for project design and leadership, including optimization and execution of antibody transport assays in our primary and iPSC-derived cell culture-based human BBB models, such as the trans-well and microfluidic BBB-Chip assays. In this capacity, the scientist will be responsible for advancing testing and prioritization of antibody hits and leads into candidates for advancement to in vivo testing. The scientist will oversee and play a hands-on role in the development and validation of various in-vitro, cell-based and in vivo assays. The candidate will also contribute to antibody target discovery efforts including preparing cells for proteomics and transcriptomics experiments. The candidate will be expected to work independently under the supervision of senior staff and faculty to design experiments, learn new skills, troubleshoot, and to take scientific leadership of significant parts of the project. The candidate will direct and mentor junior staff to clearly defined product development goals and end-user needs. They will be responsible for managing performance as well as advocating and developing junior staff. They should demonstrate an advanced understanding of phase appropriate product development milestones in accordance with technical and commercialization goals. They will work closely with Business Development and Office of Technology Development to establish commercial opportunities, licensing structures and start-up strategies. In addition, the candidate must function well in a team-oriented environment with other scientists and staff at the Institute as well as external collaborators.

Job Summary

The Wyss Institute for Biologically Inspired Engineering at Harvard University seeks an enthusiastic Senior Staff Scientist to join the Institute’s Brain Targeting Program to focus on the antibody shuttle research and development. This position is an exciting opportunity to combine cutting edge, hands-on research with the strategic considerations of technology translation and product development.

The Institute’s Brain Targeting Program is using novel human in vitro models of the blood brain barrier (BBB) to develop improved methods of transporting therapeutics and diagnostics across the BBB into the CNS (https://wyss.harvard.edu/technology/brain-targeting-shuttles-for-drug-delivery-and-diagnostics/). It’s core projects at present include a target discovery effort directed to identifying proteins on the BBB endothelial cell surface that are highly expressed and are enriched compared to endothelial cells from other organs. These proteins will be evaluated for their potential to transport cargoes across the BBB by one of several mechanisms, and then tested to validate and prioritize them for generation of antibody shuttles that bind to them. We are currently developing novel antibody shuttles directed against several known Ab shuttle targets. These will be tested in the human in vitro transwell and BBB-Chip assays, and eventually in humanized mouse models. The Wyss team is collaborating with several biopharmaceutical companies and other academic institutions to advance the BBB antibody shuttle program. We are also pursuing multiple other exploratory projects including an Alzheimer’s-on-Chip model, connections between the brain and the gut, and testing of small molecule BBB shuttles. The Brain Targeting Program is part of the Ingber lab’s Bioinspired Therapeutics and Diagnostics platform, which includes more than 20 Organ-on-Chip models and related projects. The group is collaborative and collegial and has extensive interactions between projects, people and institutions.

Job Title: Data Scientist 4

Location: Norwood, Massachusetts, USA 02062

Duration: 12 Months, potential to go permanent

Schedule: Shift (8am-5pm)

Description:

• Design and implement sophisticated Machine Learning algorithms to advance predictive analyses for point-of-care medical devices. Support internal teams in data visualization, interpretation, and provide evidence and guidance in Design of Experiments.

• Play a key role in the planning, design and execution of signal processing, time-series analysis, and predictive machine learning algorithms for highly integrated point-of-care medical devices. Strong understanding of biosensor data and diagnostic instrumentation. Think out of box for innovative approaches and solutions that are game changing in the diagnostic industry.

• The Data Scientist will enable researchers and engineers to integrate sophisticated models into the development of tailored reports, apps and dashboards for blood analyte (e.g. oxygen, lactate, glucose) signal visualization, analysis and interpretation. The Data Scientist will be expected to provide knowledge and expertise in achieving research targets, delivering on specific milestones, interpreting results, and reporting them to key stakeholders.

• The Data Scientist will have a strong interface with biosensor and engineering teams, as well as Clinical, Quality and Regulatory as needed to support bench-top, preclinical and clinical data analysis. Ensure the type and quality of data.

• The Data Scientist will be expected to conduct analyses with our database and lead the strategy and development of analysis plans for upcoming studies and trials with the goal of evaluating multiple parameters to develop unique and/or composite signature metrics/algorithms with predictive diagnostic outcomes.

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:

• MS (PhD preferred) in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering or related fields.

• Ideally formal training or extensive experience in electrochemistry or biosensors.

EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

• 5+ years Experience working with biosensor signal processing.

• Proficiency in building classification/prediction algorithms.

• Proficiency in computing languages (Python, R, Matlab, etc.) required.

• Proficiency in programming languages (C, C++, Java, Javascript) preferred.

• Familiarity with relational databases (ie. SQL).

• Experience with MiniTab, and VBA Macro preferred.

• Experience with time series analysis (ie. feature extraction, as well as Fourier, wavelet and complexity analyses approaches)

• Experience working with data from early stage biosensor prototypes, pre-clinical and clinical data.

• Experience working with human subjects, documenting experiments, and refining procedures.

• Experience with Statistical analysis and Design of Experiments.

• Ability to define strategy and manage complex projects, motivate and lead others, and work collaboratively with multidisciplinary teams

• Strong written and verbal communication, organizational and relationship-building skills.

Harvard access to athletic facilities, libraries, campus events and many discounts throughout metro Boston.

The Harvard Medical School is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position.

Department

Biomedical Informatics

Pre-Employment Screening

Education, Identity

Schedule

​35 hrs. per week | Monday - Friday | 9:00 am - 5:00 pm

Job Function

Research

Job-Specific Responsibilities

We are looking for a motivated Computational Biologist to join our interdisciplinary team in the Department of Biomedical Informatics at Harvard Medical School, for an exciting opportunity in building data analysis tools and pipelines for clinical genomics.

Genome sequencing is becoming a routine approach for diagnosing genetic diseases, as well as discovering new disease mechanisms. As the number of patients referred to genetic screening is increasing, there is a clear need to build effective solutions to manage their data for clinical applications. The same data also provides opportunities for research and discovery.

The Clinical Genomic Analysis Platform (CGAP) at Harvard Medical School is envisioned as scalable research and clinical web-based application for analysis, annotation, visualization, and reporting of genomic data. CGAP is developed by a multidisciplinary team of clinical geneticists, bioinformatics scientists and software engineers. The working environment combines the best features of a startup (fast pace, flexibility, flat hierarchies) with those of one of the leading medical schools (excellent benefits, outstanding opportunities for learning, great resources, brand recognition).

CGAP is currently seeking a full-time Bioinformatics Scientist to enhance the analysis of DNA sequencing data for our growing Genomics Program. The scope of this role will include developing, automating, and implementing leading-edge genetic software tools. These tools will facilitate the identification and annotation of disease-causing genetic variants of patients at the clinic.

School/Unit

Harvard Medical School

Fidelity TalentSource is your destination for discovering your next temporary role at Fidelity Investments. We are currently sourcing for a Scrum Master to work at Fidelity in Boston, MA

The Goal Booster team is looking for an established scrum master to support our team as we transition into the new One Stop Life Shop domain and help us tackle the technical, legal, and relationship challenges of building, scaling, and transitioning a new product within a newly emerging area of the business. This person will have a servant leadership mindset and be ready and available to tackle all manner and level of challenges from handling dependencies and our agile and legal processes to helping organize and lead the day-to-day functions of our team. We are looking for someone reciprocal and detail oriented, ideally with business/systems analysis and Fidelity experience.

The Team

You will support a startup-like team that is transitioning from Fidelity Labs to the new One Stop Life Shop domain. Fidelity Goal Booster has just launched and is now preparing for our next phase of scalable growth. As part of this dynamic team you will engage with all team members to support Agile standard methodologies, run internal and external dependencies and relationships, support the eReview and LRC processes and other project activities.

The Expertise You Have



 4 Year degree in Computer Science or other equivalent education highly desirable

Certified Scrum Master required

Validated Jira experience required

2+ years’ experience in a scrum master and/or project manager

Financial services experience preferred, but not required

Experience working in a regulated environment is preferred, but not required

Preference for those candidates who have a detailed understanding of standard Agile methodologies, DevOps, and Agile measurement techniques

The Skills You Bring



 You possess superb communication and people-interaction skills, and can rapidly build trust

You are detail oriented, organized and experienced at project and program management

You have a continuous improvement mindset

You are capable of promoting agile practices to teams and individuals across different functions, experiences, and geographies

You are a validated effective facilitator and can influence without direct authority

You are intellectually curious and model a culture of learning and coaching

You adopt the idea of being a servant leader for your team

The Value You Deliver



 Leading and coordinating logistics for agile ceremonies (e.g., backlog prioritization, sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives)

Working proactively with team members to enable the delivery of our roadmap

Encouraging behaviors and practices that increase team performance and efficiency

Maintaining and updating relevant performance metrics (e.g., burn-down charts) and documentation to provide an effective feedback loop to the team and visibility to other partners while supporting the consistent use of enabling tools such as Jira, Sharepoint etc..

Managing dependencies across the business, including relationship and partner management to actively remove impediments identified by the team.

Supporting the e-review process by working with our legal partners to help shepherd content and releases through the eReview and LRC processes.

Helping the team navigate and integrate as we transition into our new domain

Company Culture

At Fidelity, you can find it all here. We reward ambitious, passionate individuals with a work environment that fosters diversity, teamwork and collaboration as well as encourages innovative ideas and fresh thinking. We recognize the value that employees’ individual differences can contribute to the bright and strong future of our company.

Title

Research Assistant II

13-Apr-2020

Department

Medicine-Developmental Medicine

AutoReqId

Full-Time

Job Posting Description

At Boston Children’s Hospital, success is measured in patients treated, parents comforted and teams taught. It’s in discoveries made, processes perfected, and technology advanced. In major medical breakthroughs and small acts of kindness. And in colleagues who have your back and patients who have your heart. As a teaching hospital of Harvard Medical School, our reach is global and our impact is profound. Join our acclaimed team to see how your talents can change lives. Yours included.

The Laboratories of Cognitive Neuroscience (LCN) and Department of Neurology at Boston Children’s Hospital are dedicated to furthering our understanding of brain and cognitive development in children diagnosed with or at risk for various developmental disorders. Our multidisciplinary team of researchers brings together experts from a wide range of fields, including neuroscience, psychology, computer science, medicine, mathematics, and education.

The LCN, in partnership with the Department of Neurology, are seeking a full-time Research & Technology Assistant to provide engineering and signal processing support on a variety of research projects collectively focused on typical and atypical brain development in infants and young children. Responsibilities will include setup, maintenance, and experiment programming of research equipment for electroencephalography (EEG) and eye tracking, along with signal processing for analysis of results collected using these systems. The position is for a minimum of two years.

To qualify, you must have:


A bachelor’s degree in biomedical engineering, computer science, psychology, cognitive science, neuroscience, or related fieldAt least one year of experience working in a research setting (preferably paid professional experience, but may include undergraduate research experiences) Experience with EEG, ERP, and/or eye tracking hardware and software (e.g., ePrime, Presentation, Netstation, BrainVision, Tobii, EyeLink)Excellent computer skills; Comfortable with maintaining the OS of Macs and PCsPrevious experience with coding (preferably including MATLAB experience)High level of motivation; ability to work independently and as part of a team; excellent communication, organization, and attention to detail 


Boston Children’s Hospital offers competitive compensation and unmatched benefits, including a rotating days/evenings and week-end schedule, affordable health, vision and dental insurance, generous levels of time off, 403(b) Retirement Savings plan, Pension, Tuition Reimbursement and discounted rates on T-passes (50% off). Discover your best.

Schedule

Job Function

Human Resources

Job-Specific Responsibilities


Develop an HR agenda and strategies to support the strategic mission and Community Values of Harvard Medical School.Guide the HR team in all aspects of human resources and continue developing a responsive, credible and effective function. Direct the team to effectively deliver relevant, innovative and service-focused resolutions for the school leadership and employees.Align HR priorities with HMS and Senior Administrative Leadership Team strategic priorities.Partner with the HMS Chief Information Officer to ensure Human Resources effective systems and trusted data sources to inform decisions and enable compliance.Support the ability of staff members to operate more efficiently and effectively.Provide counsel and guidance to the Medical School’s senior leaders and community to create an inclusive and collaborative culture. Build an HR strategy to ensure a diverse, inclusive and high- performing workforce.Drive innovative talent acquisition and management strategy and provide data-driven competitive solutions. Promote effective plans and programs aimed at sourcing, evaluating, recruiting, assimilating and developing strong talent.Strengthen outreach and hiring practices to broaden the diversity and inclusion of the HMS community.Drive commitment to a culture of change and adaptability; of less bureaucratic processes; of lower hierarchical barriers to intra-office collaboration; and a freedom to recommend innovation.Analyze the effectiveness of OHR procedures and oversee the evolution from what has been viewed externally as primarily transactional to a more collaborative, responsive, pro-active relationship with our clients.Actively engage in school-wide committee initiatives.Design and deliver measures of accountability to assess and ensure service excellence; measure the achievement of goals and expectations; assess the effectiveness of programs and services, and promote evidence-based decision making.Foster productive and collaborative relationships with senior leaders in Faculty Affairs, Diversity and Community Partnerships and other academic and research departments.Integrate the HMS Community Values more broadly into all HR activities.The CHRO will also work collaboratively with the University’s Vice President for Human Resources to ensure alignment with and implementation of broader university goals and initiatives.


School/Unit

Harvard Medical School

EEO Statement

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job Summary

Reporting to the Executive Dean for Administration, the Harvard Medical School (HMS) Chief Human Resources Officer (CHRO) is responsible for developing and executing human resources strategy in support of the school’s strategic plan and direction. This person will specifically lead in the areas of talent management, employee relations, compensation, HRIS and analytics, HR compliance, change management, organizational and performance management, and learning and development. The CHRO provides strategic leadership by driving a culture that is aligned with HMS vision and mission.

The position of CHRO represents an exciting opportunity to be a key member of the senior leadership team and impact the human capital, as well as the future, of the School. The ideal candidate will be a highly experienced executive with a strong working knowledge of human resources principles and programs and an effective leader with solid interpersonal and communication skills. The CHRO will be engaged, confident, and innovative, and possess high energy and integrity. In addition, they will possess strategic- thinking abilities and have an exceptional capacity to build collaborative relationships with staff and faculty at all levels. Given a variety of current initiatives currently underway, the CHRO will serve as one of several transformational change agents within the HMS leadership team.

Brief Job Description (essential functions of the job):

Under direction performs work of considerable difficulty in traffic engineering relative to traffic control systems and traffic management in the Traffic Management Center. Responsibilities




 Plans, schedules, supervises and reviews work of subordinate personnel.
Supervises and participates in traffic operations engineering work including traffic signal timing projects, signalized intersection design and programming traffic responsive control parameters to improve traffic flow and safety on arterial streets.
Supervises and participates in the implementation of system updates and operation of a computerized traffic signal system.
Ensures all completed installations of traffic control systems have met the required specifications.
Supervises the planning, design, and construction of intersections relative to the installation and operation of traffic signals.
Supervises and participates in the compilation of statistical data and technical reports required by superiors.
Performs related duties as required.

Work Schedule/Hours: Monday - Friday, 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

Required to work any and all emergencies as directed by the Commissioner or designee. Minimum Entrance Qualifications




 Four (4) years of traffic engineering experience, two (2) years of which must have been in a supervisory capacity.
A bachelor's degree in civil or electrical engineering is preferred and may be substituted for two (2) years of the required experience.
Working knowledge of the MUTCD, HCM, AASHTO, and Complete Streets guidelines as well as proficiency with Synchro, SimTraffic, and AutoCAD software packages.
Professional Engineer (PE) license or Engineer in Training (EIT) certificate is preferred.
Experience in successfully completing traffic engineering projects (such as: sign and pavement marking plans, traffic signal design, crash analysis and safety studies, complete streets design projects, intersection design projects, traffic signal timing and operational analysis, etc).
Ability to exercise good judgement and focus on detail as required by the job.
Must have and maintain a current and valid Massachusetts driver's license.

Job Posting DescriptionAt Boston Children’s Hospital, success is measured in patients treated, parents comforted and teams taught. It’s in discoveries made, processes perfected, and technology advanced through major medical breakthroughs and small acts of kindness. And in colleagues who have your back and patients who have your heart. As a teaching hospital of Harvard Medical School, our reach is global and our impact is profound. Join our acclaimed Neurology Team and discover how your talents can change lives. Yours included.

We are looking for an experienced Clinical Research Manager to join the Neuromuscular Research Group in the Neurology Department of Boston Children’s Hospital.

The group is headed by Dr. Basil T. Darras, who specializes in molecular genetics and diagnostics of Duchenne and Becker muscular dystrophies, spinal muscular atrophy, and other myopathies, and on defining the indications for new diagnostic methodologies in the evaluation of children with pediatric neuromuscular diseases. His clinical focus is the care of children with neuromuscular conditions originating from inherited or acquired conditions of the motor unit. The Neuromuscular Group at BCH is a major site for clinical studies on spinal muscular atrophy and muscular dystrophy.

Minimum Education and Experience

Work requires the knowledge of theories, principles, and concepts acquired through completion of a Bachelor's degree and a minimum of 8 years of relevant work experience or Master of Science and 4 yrs of relevant work experience.Applicants must have demonstrated ability in the following areas: Human Subjects Research Protections, working with the IRB, and FDA Regulatory requirements Working with Sponsors—industry, foundation, federal—to develop budgets, CTAs, and study startups Extensive Clinical Trials experience • Project Management Expertise Proven track record of managing and training staff in a research setting Additionally, applicants must be well-organized in order to manage multiple projects, responsibilities, and competing demands simultaneously. Working well on a team, as well as with other staff members, patients (children and families), providers, and departmental leadership is essential. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential.

Work Shift:1st shift (United States of America)Please review the following job description:Contribute to the delivery of corporate products and services to clients in the Corporate and Investment Banking Division. Perform origination of new products and monitor business relationships in portfolios assigned to respective teams. Day-to-day responsibilities will depend on specific team assignments to include Corporate Banking, Syndications, Treasury Management or Client Derivatives. Note: Analysts/Associates will be differentiated by size and complexity of portfolio, experience and other criteria determined relevant by Capital Markets Corporate Banking Division.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities: 

Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.

Contribute to assigned team by originating and processing new business, demonstrating strong technical skills such as financial analysis, credit underwriting and a solid understanding of capital markets.Manage risk by ensuring compliance with policies and procedures and completing processes thoroughly and accurately, including submitting credit packages for approval, ensuring new products and services are implemented correctly and providing clients with thorough market analysis. Proactively monitor an assigned client portfolio, advising on trends and forward-looking indicators such as commodity price changes or other major drivers that would impact the risk profile of the portfolio. Enable complex client servicing by facilitating consistent, effective communication internally with team members and other departments to provide superior client service and effective risk management. Effectively monitor, maintain and update pertinent information using Bank’s contact management system and other resources to ensure excellent data integrity. Develop skills in client relationship management, credit underwriting, risk management and industry and product expertise in order to contribute to team objectives and meet client’s changing needs in a competitive market. Acquire and utilize proficient knowledge in order to effectively educate internal associates on the purpose and benefits of assigned product area.Keep abreast of changing business, market and economic developments impacting the portfolio, profitability and financial services industry in general.

Required Skills and Competencies: 

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics or equivalent education and related trainingOne year of experience in the financial services industry with direct experience dealing with commercial or corporate clients through commercial lending, capital markets, treasury management and/or related areasCompetent understanding in assigned area including corporate banking, syndications, treasury management and derivatives with experience in underwriting, structuring and closing transactions as appropriateGeneral knowledge of Capital Markets, Treasury Management, Deposits, Specialized Lending, Institutional Trust, Insurance, Sterling and International products and servicesStrong analytical and quantitative skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills Solid understanding of financial and cost accounting principles Strong initiative with ability to work both independently and within a teamDemonstrated proficiency in basic computer applications such as Microsoft Office productsAbility to travel, occasionally overnight

Desired Skills:

Master’s degree in a business-related field Professional accreditation in applicable fields Experience in bank operations as it relates to corporate services

Job Posting Description

At Boston Children’s Hospital, success is measured in patients treated, parents comforted and teams taught. It’s in discoveries made, processes perfected, and technology advanced. In major medical breakthroughs and small acts of kindness. And in colleagues who have your back and patients who have your heart. As a teaching hospital of Harvard Medical School, our reach is global and our impact is profound. Join our acclaimed Oncology/Hematology Inpatient Unit and discover how your talents can change lives. Yours included.

The Lead Patient Experience Representative will be responsible for:


Leading and overseeing work of designated patient experience staff. Planning, prioritizing and delegating work assignments; monitoring performance, providing feedback and guidance as needed.Serving as a resource on departmental policies and procedures; providing assistance in resolving administrative problems and issues. Training and orienting new personnel.Providing input into selection, evaluation and discipline of administrative staff.Monitoring unit operations activity to ensuring the best possible patient experience. Assisting with resolving customer service and scheduling issues. Responding to patients' concerns and needs, offering the best possible appointment options and resolutions to other patient concerns in accordance with our best practices and procedures. Responding to situations requiring escalated service response.Providing positive and effective customer service that supports departmental and hospital operations. Greeting and directing patients, families and visitors. Monitoring daily schedule and patient flow. Communicating with clinicians and/or supervisor and route patients/visitors to maintain efficient patient/visitor flow.Verifying, recording and processing patient demographics, insurance/payment and referral information for patient appointments. Collecting all necessary clinical documentation and information. Transcribing code and patient treatment information into billing system.Answering, screening and routing phone calls. Recording and forwarding messages and triaging calls for urgent information or services. Responding to requests for routine information or assistance within scope of knowledge and authority. Initiating calls for emergency services.Participating in the development of training programs to update staff on department/hospital processes, including patient experience focused initiatives and computer training.Providing assistance to nursing staff in evaluating and resolving problems/issues.Participating in and contributing to departmental and organizational initiatives & projects with a focus on continuous process improvement.Recommending and assisting in implementing change in internal systems and procedures.


To qualify you must have:


A high school diploma and 2-3 years of closely related experience in a healthcare setting. Associates Degree preferred.The ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing and provide empathy in difficult interpersonal situations.The ability to work with diverse internal and external constituencies.


Shift: Monday-Friday Days

Since Boston is announcing prolonged school closure upon the outbreak of COVID-19, and as most childcare facilities follow suit, healthcare workers, first responders, and other emergency personnel have been left with no obvious solutions for childcare. The bottom line is that the continued functioning of the essential services of the United States demands a solution for the identified and urgent need for qualified and reliable childcare options.

We want our essential workers to execute their services in the exceptional ways that they do and will do, we must offer them the full knowledge that their children are in the care of loving and supportive adults able to meet their physical and developmental needs, and to provide them with the stability, calm, and serenity that it is the obligations of all adults to offer children in times of crisis.

Guidepost Montessori is stepping up with options during this time, and looking for passionate educators ready to support children's development during these uncertain times. We are activating our network of parents, teachers and contacts to create in-home care locations and pop-up locations near essential workers.Your RoleWe're looking for an enthusiastic, adaptable Emergency Childcare Workers who have a passion for working with children.

This position is a temporary role for the duration of the COVID-19 response. You would provide care for a small group of children while diligently following safety and sanitation requirements and recommendations by the CDC. The services would be at our existing Guidepost Montessori schools, in-home care locations, or at pop-up locations to provide emergency services.

This role is a great opportunity to support the essential workers that support the health, safety and welfare of the public. While most positions will end when childcare and schools are able to re-open, Guidepost is a growing network of schools that is willing to sponsor Montessori training for exceptional staff.About You



Experience working with children ages 0-6
Valid Background Check
Ability to work well with other adults
Growth mindset and problem-solving approach
Familiarity with the Montessori approach to education is preferred, but not required


About UsGuidepost Montessori is a community of trained educators who are driven by a deep desire to bring about widespread change in education today. To meet the needs of today's students and to bring about true progress in the world around us, we need an education model that fosters independence and develops competent, capable, action-oriented thinkers and change agents. To that end, we are committed to dramatically increasing the amount of high-fidelity, authentic Montessori programs, not only in the U.S., but around the globe!

If you love children and have been looking for the right opportunity to grow, join our community by applying below!
